story:
This fund raising campaign is  intended to raise to raise money to help the grand opening of Mama's Suga Shack. As owner of Mama's Suga Shack, I am thrilled to have landed such a wonderful space to house my restaurant. From the moment that I laid eyes on it, I felt that connection, and once I stepped inside there was no question that we were meant to be together. I have invested my money, my time, and physical energy, complied with my vision and determination in something that I believe in whole heartily.

I am confident in the future success of Mama's Suga Shack, and the many positive community connections that will derive from its existence. Mama's Suga Shack restaurant aims to be the community watering whole. A place that's drenched in community diversity, people bonding together in a soothing and uplifting atmosphere as they savor comforting food and conversation. Those of you who already know of Mama's Suga Shack can already relate and I would like to take the time to thank you sincerely for all of you phone calls and emails of well wishes.

story:
Short Summary

Park’s Place will provide a locally sourced, high-quality dining experience to the residents of Athens County Ohio and the surrounding areas to create a community that is more sustainable and cooperative.

Owned by Cory Richards & Josh Vernon, Park’s Place will make community advancement and superior quality its primary focus. Its investment and commitment to the local economy of Athens County and surrounding areas, and the people who support it, will be held above all else. Park’s Place will offer dine-in, take-out and large party accommodations and strive to be environmentally responsible. Due to these core values and diverse offerings, Park’s Place will be a premier locally supplied restaurant in Athens County.

About the Owner's:

  • Cory Richards – Cory grew up in Barlow, Ohio and during his childhood would spend his summers in Amesville on his grandparent’s farm. Cory developed a passion for cooking at a very young age which has evolved into a fanatical hobby in his adult years. Since then, Cory has catered food for weddings and events, cooked as a sous chef for 5 course wine dinners, and finds any reason to make people happy through good food. Supporting local farmers and creating food with local ingredients is very important to him.

 

  • Josh Vernon – Josh is a 5th generation Amesville resident. He has countless childhood memories of helping his family on their farm located on Sand Rock Road where he now lives. He has ten years of experience in customer service and a bachelor’s degree in Animal Science. When he’s not busy with his ‘day job’, he enjoys helping out in the local community by volunteering for the Amesville Fire Department, the Athens County Junior Fair Sale Committee and many other community events.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Park's Place doesn't just want a hand-out, we want you to want to support this venture and for doing so you will be rewarded with awesome perks! The reward structure is tiered and each tier builds off the previous so the more you donate the more you get in return (besides just an awesome farm-to-table restaurant ran by two groovy dudes). At the mid-range level ($200) you receive a coupon for a free dessert, a Park's Place decal, Park's Place t-shirt, a coupon for 15% off all orders for the first six months of operations and a ticket for you and a guest to attend a private dinner event scheduled for July 13th 2019.
  • Park's Place is hoping to raise $20,000 to help with start-up costs. Start-up costs include the following:
    • Two weeks of operating costs (food, wages, etc.)
    • Two events (a private dinner event July 13th 2019 and family / friends soft opening July 14th 2019)
    • All the small things (plates, silverware, cups, bowls, pots, pans, napkins, etc.)
    • All the big things (furniture, fixtures, equipment and point of sales system)
    • Renovations to the existing space
      • Updated bathrooms & dining area
      • Mix of farmhouse & industrial concepts
      • Family & community oriented
      • Bright, warm & welcoming
  • Even if Park's Place doesn't reach their goal of $20,000 the funds will still go towards the previously mentioned items. Whatever we don't raise we will have to sell our houses to finance (just kidding, maybe just an arm and a leg).

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you can't contribute with funds today, you can still help Park's Place by getting the word out. Share this campaign on your social media, free marketing is priceless.

Renovations to the existing space

Family & community oriented
Bright, warm & welcoming

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute with funds today, you can still help Park's Place by getting the word out. Share this campaign on your social media, free marketing is priceless.

story:
What started originally as an idea by Chef/Founder, Rouha Sadighi, for a dope, neighborhood breakfast spot, that can make a true over medium egg, transformed into a food truck..which then grew into selling wholesale Rico Suaves to the best coffee shops in LA/OC..and now has turned into us needing our own home! After loads of hustling, slinging Rico Suaves, Bodegas and all your other favorite hits, Rouha along with her business partner and close friend, Tim Mokry, have found a location to call home! The Rooster will be moving into the Pico/Robertson neighborhood and we couldn't be more stoked! 

In order to make this happen, we are looking for some love and support from our loyal fans! What's in it for you? Literally everything. Well not everything, but helping with this means:

- The Rooster, seven days a week, rain or shine, private events on the truck or not!
- An expanded menu including a slightly more extensive brunch menu on the weekends
- A central location that's close to most any place you could be coming from (which is probably the biggest perk in LA)
- Shwag and merch 
- A place to kick it with friends, family and loved ones, that has chairs and tables and a roof (yooooo!)

And hey, we get it, not everyone is in a place to help out financially and that's A-OK with us! You can still show MAJOR support by sharing our campaign to your networks via email, social media, texts, or phone calls. Sharing is caring and we know how much community plays a key part in making great things happen. We're living for allllllll of it!

story:
Peace and Love. My name is Charita Pressey. I go by the name "Afua Nsowaa"  I am a Plant based Chef, Writer, and Holistic Healer. I have had a strong passion for cooking ever since I was a young girl. Growing up in foster care I was not afforded many opportunities to practice and master my craft. Once I became an adult I set out to do what I have always yearned to do. In 2013  I started Angie's Catering Company in memory of my mother. Fortunately for me, not long after I began a healthy lifestyle change and gave birth to Love, Light, and Alkaline Eatery. Love, Light, and Alkaline Eatery is a plant based meal prep and mobile vending company currently based out of Jacksonville Fl. Since 2014 I have serviced over 1,000 clients and attended many successful vending events. My mission is to aid the community in healing thru the art of food, act of love, and wisdom of light. It is important for me to share my story of how I overcame poor health and depression by simply changing what I put into my body by way of food, actions, and words. My goal is to birth an alkaline vegan food truck and spread my message throughout the world. As a contributor you will not only help me achieve this goal but you will also help bring flavor, diversity, and a whole lot of love to the vegan community of Jacksonville FL.

I am starting from scratch and will need a new or custom made food truck which cost anywhere from 50-60 k

My focus is to make a major impact on the community. It is my hopes that thru my food truck I will motivate, inspire, and empower others to eat an animal free/ cruelty free diet. That in itself will be a major catalyst for world peace and change.

story:
Fresh Coffee Roasted Right Here in Oklahoma

Home City Roast is a budding coffee roastery right here in the plains of Oklahoma. Starting with just a popcorn roaster and a stovetop, we've honed our craft and roasted pounds and pounds of coffee, all in our pursuit for the perfect Oklahoma Roast. A new roaster more designed to meet our demand will set us on the right path to transition from an in-home hobby to a rewarding and fulfilling vocation!

What We Need

We need to raise $3,000.00 to buy a roaster that can meet more commercial needs so we can begin to sell our coffee for the first time. Here's a link to the roaster we would like to buy: Aillio Bullet Roaster

What You Get

We've added three different contribution perks to thank our supporters for the incredible generosity you've shown so far. Depending on your contribution,  you can earn up to a fridge magnet, a fresh bag of Home City Roast, and a premium designed ceramic coffee mug - check out our perks to learn more!

Note: If you contributed before our perks went live, don't worry! We will be including all contributions in our perk fulfillments that meet the respective values. Thank you for all of the support!

Your Impact

By supporting us in our stage of infancy, you'll be a key building block to the foundation of our roastery and will help us take the first step necessary in our goal of selling fresh Oklahoma roasted coffee to customers and cafes around the state and beyond. We are also seeking to provide fundraising initiatives to nonprofit organizations around the state - your support can make that a reality by starting the first ripple in a pond of both innovation and altruism.

Risks and Challenges

Our greatest challenge in launching a roastery involves transitioning from a home-roasted experience to a brick and mortar roastery qualified to provide fresh roasted batches in a commercial setting. We are actively engaged in the process and policies necessary to transition our roastery into such a physical setting. Funding an industrial roaster serves as key stepping stone to the path we have carved ahead. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people simply cannot or are not prepared to financially contribute - that's okay. We never want you to feel obligated to contribute. Sharing our funding campaign, reaching out for coffee tastings and supporting the experience provides just as powerful of an impact.

We would love to see our roasting experience evolve and grow for many years to come!

story:
After 8 years of chocolate making in two countries, on opposite ends of the world, Metiisto is ready to expand production. 

Metiisto started life as a pioneer of the Swedish Craft chocolate movement back in 2012. We sourced  the worlds finest cocoas and lovingly crafted it into silky smooth chocolate that went on to win us four silver medals at the Academy of Chocolate Awards in 2016.

In 2018,  Metiisto was moved to Toowoomba, Australia. This time around, we wanted to help make a change in the chocolate industry by finding cocoa, that was closer to Australia and something with big potential. When we tested samples of cocoa from the Solomon Islands we knew this was what we wanted to do.

Our first bars won 3 gold medals at the RASV Australian Food Awards three months after opening, and in 2019 we took that up to 5 golds, 3 silvers, Best in Class and won the the 'Best Australian Small Producer' trophy. We also took home a gold and the prized 'International Rising Star' trophy at the Academy of Chocolate Awards the same year.

To meet the ever growing demand for our award winning chocolate and chocolate based products we need to upgrade our machines. These machines are needed for us to make larger batches of chocolate and produce more of our amazing chocolate covered nuts and flavored bars.

What we need

A chocolate factory needs many specialized machines. Most of our current machines are home made, heavily modified and re purposed from other industries. We have gotten this far on our own, but now we need help to take it to the next level.

We are looking for funding for two main things: A new panning machine and cocoa inventory.

A large panning machine will give us the ability to finally launch a range of chocolate covered nuts, fruits and even crispy centers. We have faced many hurdles with keeping enough cocoa beans and cocoa butter in stock at all times and would love to buy in at least a few tons of cocoa. Any additional money, that can be raised will be put into buying more cocoa and electrical upgrades to the factory for the new machines.

We have secured leasing for the largest machine we need for the making of larger batches of chocolate, the additional machine and supply of cocoa will help us make more of yummy chocolate and chocolate products.

Metiisto is dedicated to transparency in the cocoa industry. By supporting us you are supporting the hard work of the cocoa farmers in the Solomon Islands, that make this all possible. We are only a small family owned and operated business, that is only a drop in the ocean compared to the big players in this industry, but all big things start small and we have big dreams and the know how to make a positive difference in the chocolate industry.

Risks & Challenges

Chocolate making is a risky business, but no matter if we meet our goal or not the funds will be put to good use.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you !

story:
A unique experience in Brussels

Pour en apprendre plus en Français: suivez le lien.

Om meer in het Nederlands te leren, klik hier.

Fermenthings brings together two friends who love to eat and drink. That's a good start! But our shop will also includes you in the fantastic fermentation world. Scared of bacterias or fungi? You shouldn't be: almost 2/3 of our food and beverage are made from fermentation. Think about: beer, wine, cheese, coffee, chocolate, salamis... Feeling hungry yet?

 

 

  • We: Julien and Yannick, are ready to jump into a great adventure! With Cédric joining the team, our passion and knowledge will be put into your service. We will learn with you, teach our knowledge or share the delicious drinks and foods we will find.
  • With the modern and western consumption, we have forgotten important things about nature and conservation. Having a fridge is great, but eating all-made food and frozen goods is far from the experience epicurians love. Learn to know who makes your products, how it is made and which techniques from our ancestors can be used to bring into your personnal lifestyle... That is our goal!
  • Helping us through this Indiegogo campaign will provide us a helping hand. Participate in this new project and be a part of our adventure's launch!

What is fermentation?

Let's enter the classroom a moment to understand fermentation. Okay, you got it? Be carefull even with a nice speech and video, there are still some common mistakes that we all do. For instance: alcohol is made with yeast (a mushroom) and not bacteria. So you see: we can learn together something everyday!

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Going to the bank is nice and safe, sure. But getting you involved is the perfect way to express our vision and goal. To create an active community to explore a forgotten world: fermentation!
  • Each pack was made to allow you to choose easily. You really want to meet us during the official opening? No problem! You want to have a first glimpse into fermentation at home? Roger that! You want to become a big deal in our project? Also possible!
  • Our project is already moving. As you are reading those lines, we are working hard to build furniture, find beers and taste food. But each help (little or big) will show us that our project matters to you and that we were right to think fermentation should become trendy.
 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Missed our first packages? Willing to meet us before getting involved? Or you have a fermentation product to share?

  • Contact us directly on: fermenthings@gmail.com or visit (and follow) our social medias (Facebook, Twitter and Instagram).
  • Spread the words: sharing this campaign or talking about Fermenthings will help us!

story:
After 25 years of marriage, two kids, years of working in restaurants, bakeries, schools, and clubs, what's next?

Opening our own place. The Bard's Bounty, located on the Lacey-Olympia border, will feature great food, live acoustic music, and RPG/tabletop gaming. Amy is a cook whose resume includes The Biltmore Estate and Anthony's, along with a decade of food service and kitchen management. Joel is a musician and gamer who has booked, mixed, and run music venues in Denver and Seattle. 

So why Indiegogo?

Along with having a lot of experience in these kinds of places, we've both done our homework. Times ten. We know that however much runway cash you think you've got, assume you need more. Licenses, equipment rentals, signage, repairs, insurance, there's no end to it. Not to mention the fact that when we finally went public with our grand plan, we had friend after friend coming up to us and asking if we were looking for investors. Well, the short answer was 'no'. This was not something we were designing to scale up and give investors a 10x return on their money. We were just looking to create a great acoustic music and game venue with tasty food.  "That's all we want," they said. "We know Amy's an amazing chef, and if there's a way we can help you get off the ground, and maybe have a few free beers whenever we're in Olympia, it's a win-win!"

That made sense to us. So we've decided to open The Bard's Bounty up to contributions with some fun perks, purchases and gifts thrown in. Take advantage if you feel so inclined. Whether you do or not, you'll always have a table waiting near the stage. Pull a guitar off the wall, come on up and teach us a tune. 

Thanks much!

Amy and Joel

story:
Was ist WASTED?

WASTED ist Weltverbesserung, die man trinken kann. 

Laut der Welternährungsorganisation FAO landet ein Drittel aller weltweit produzierten Lebensmittel im Müll. In Wien wird jeden Tag soviel Brot weggeworfen, wie Graz am Tag isst. Wir von WASTED finden, Brot gehört gegessen, oder in unserem Fall getrunken, und nicht auf den Müll! 

Unsere ersten 2 Biersorten sind KORNSPITZ – Cream Ale und SEMMEL – Lager. Die Brotaromen verleihen dem Bier einen unvergleichlichen Geschmack. Da kann man schon mal mit gutem Gewissen einen über den Durst trinken. 

Wir brauchen eure Unterstützung, um unsere WASTED-Prototypen zu finanzieren, zu vermarkten, um noch mehr Brot vor der Tonne zu retten, und um weitere Brauexperimente zu starten.

 

Wer sind wir?

Hinter WASTED stehen die WASTEBOYS:
Tobias Judmaier: Zerowaste-Unternehmer und Gründer von Iss mich! 
Mit seinem Bio-Catering verkocht er in Wien Gemüse, das für den Handel zu krumm ist.

David Gross: Filmemacher, Mülltaucher und Gründer von WASTECOOKING. Mit seiner konsumkritischen Kochshow kocht er inzwischen weltweit gegen Verschwendung auf. 

Für die ersten 2 WASTED-Prototypen haben die WASTEBOYS den Braumeister Rainer Mraz von der Bierstarter-Brauerei ins Boot geholt. 

 

Welche Geschichte steckt dahinter?

Die Kunst aus Brot Bier zu brauen ist so alt wie die Kulturgeschichte der Menschheit. Schon die alten Ägypter und Babylonier nutzten hart gewordenes Brot, um ein URBIER herzustellen. Braumeister aus Belgien und aus England haben diese Kunst in den letzten Jahren wieder aufgegriffen. Der WASTED-Ansatz, Bier aus unverkauftem Biobrot zu brauen, ist aber bisher einzigartig. Das Waste-Brot wird im Braukessel zu frischem Quellwasser, Hefe, Hopfen und Gerstenmalz zugefügt. Es ersetzt bis zu einem Drittel des Braumalzes und wird im Brauprozeß zu vergärbarem Zucker umgewandelt.

 

Was haben wir mit dem Geld vor? 

Mit den 15.000 Euro wollen wir einen Teil unserer Startkosten für das Projekt abdecken.

Dazu zählen:

  • Die Biozertifizierung des Bieres
  • Die Produktion von Etiketten und Kronenkorken
  • Das Grafik-Design von Label und Webseite
  • Die Herstellung von Bierkartons und Marketingartikeln
  • Eine Kampagne zur Vermeidung von Lebensmittelverschwendung

Was bekommt ihr von uns? 

Natürlich haben wir bierige Goodies für euch auf Lager:
Let’s get wasted STICKER und BIERDECKEL
WASTED T-Shirts aus Bio-Baumwolle
Das originale WASTED Bierglas
Die obligatorischen 6er Tragerl 

Und für besonders großen Support bieten wir:
Eine exklusive Einladung zum Brotbier-Barbecue über den Dächern von Wien

 

Wie kann man uns noch unterstützen?

Du hast einen Gastronomie-Betrieb oder ein Lebensmittel-Geschäft und möchtest unser Bier verkaufen?

Du machst einen Event und möchtest unser Bier dort haben? Wir kommen und schenken es aus!

Du bist ein Bio Bäcker und hast Brot übrig? Wir verbrauen es für dich!

Du engagierst dich gegen Lebensmittelverschwendung und brauchst die passende 

Erfrischung?

Melde dich bei uns. 

 

Warum WASTED?

In einer Welt der begrenzten Ressourcen, ist der Kampf gegen Lebensmittelverschwendung ein Gebot der Stunde. Die WASTEBOYS haben mit ihren Vorgängerprojekten bewiesen, dass ihnen Nachhaltigkeit im Lebensmittelbereich ein wirkliches Anliegen sind. WASTED zeigt das Problem der Brotverschwendung auf und liefert den genussvollen Lösungsansatz gleich mit dazu. Die bessere Welt kann verdammt gut schmecken. Lasst uns gemeinsam darauf anstossen! Let’s get wasted for a better world!

story:
All Natural Energizing Peppermint will refresh you in the morning, and give you caffeine kick plus fresh breath!

FUN FACT:

Once you enjoy the mints, you can reuse the packaging for something else too! Our AWARD-WINNING gasket tin packaging is very durable, compact and water resistant, pack your ESSENTIALS (some cash, earbuds, charging cord, etc.) in it and bring it with you as your PERFECT travel companion :)

 

 

These Energizing mocha mint is our original peppermint mixed with mouthwatering decadent mocha flavor. A perfect substitute to save your time from those never ending coffee lines.

Replace your harmful daily fat burning pills that you have to swallow with this minty fresh fat burning mint.

FUN FACT: 

This AWARD-WINNING packaging is designed with a mirror attached, perfect for your active lifestyle! Stuff it with your essentials and you have a freshening kit after sweaty workout :)

Our delicious All Natural Bedtime Peppermints tin contains 20 mints, just enough to relax your body and help you rest through the night.

 

 

 

 

We use only the best ingredients to create an amazing tasting mint for our customers. We manufacture our own products from all natural ingredients and located in United States of America, specifically in Davie, Florida. We are proud to be MADE IN USA. We have complete control of the entire process of manufacturing our mints from raw ingredients to packaging to fulfillment. We do not outsource our work. This ensures the highest quality and consistency for each mint at every step of the process. We follow and go beyond FDA guidelines to validate our equipment and sourcing ingredients. You purchase our mints knowing we guarantee the highest quality and you are supporting an American made product.

Our mints are delicious and 100% Natural. Our ingredients are sourced from the best raw ingredients local manufacturers you can find. They are all FDA registered. Our ingredients were reviewed individually by television talk show host, Dr. Mehmet Cengiz Öz.

Essential Mints is an exciting new business in the Functional Food Industry. The idea arose from the minds of two successful entrepreneurs, who were looking for a product that would be helpful and make an impact in their (and other's) active lifestyle. They have brought their years of successful business and manufacturing knowledge to building this new concept. Patents and trademarks have been filed. We are looking forward to bringing many new products to the market with your help and feedback.

With your support, we would like to use the capital to develop our product line and expand our factory so we can continue to create jobs. We currently offer delicious tasting Energizing Mints, Fat Burning Mints, and Bed Time Mints. We are developing other products by function and flavors soon.

We are also focusing on securing mutual partnerships with large retailers companies, specially convenience stores & distributors & fitness centers sector below:

Essential Mints are formulated with tantalizing refreshing peppermint flavor and just a right amount of caffeine. They are a healthy substitute to replace your expensive morning coffee and unhealthy sugary energy drinks. Not to mention that Essential Mints are one of the lowest price per mg of caffeine than any other product.

Product Comparison

Caffeine Comparison

  • Winner of 2015 GDUSA American Graphic Design Awards for Logo & Package Design
  • Winner of 2016 GDUSA Health & Wellness Design Awards for Advertising & Package Design
  • Featured New Product in Vitamin Retailer’s November 2016 Issue
  • Featured Product on ABC7’s December 9th Finneys Fridays TV Segment
  • Featured in DIY Active’s “How effective can a Fat Burner Mint be?"
  • My Style Spot Product Review by HuffPost writer, Cindy Bachelor
  • Weight Loss Category Finalist of SupplySide West CPG Editors’ Choice Awards

RISKS & CHALLENGE

Our factory and team is ready to go. We do not see any foreseeable risks or hurdles in the near future as we have been manufacturing in our own facility and have worked out any and all issues with our products early on. However, our production will be more effective with your help and you can rest assure that our product will ship on time right to your front door.

DISCLAIMER

These products have not been evaluated by Food and Drug Administration. These products are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure or prevent any disease. Do not take if you are pregnant or nursing. Consult with doctor before use if you are on medication or have a medical condition. Not intended for anyone under the age of 18.

story:
Shutter Tea Café

 

Introduction

Dear Friends,
I'm happy to see you look up this project and get to know "What the-?" is going on. My name is Anastasija and I'll guide you through this HUGE Project that combines cafe and Youth Centre.
The project is called "Shutter Tea Cafe" - I took out "Shutter" from photography terminology, due to being photographer and actually having ART as a big part of this place; "Tea" - literally, we'll have a wast selection of different teas to choose from, as well as it's CAFE - therefore the ending is "Cafe".
The name itself is giving out the concept of involving both Art and Food/Bakery in it, yet as a contemporary twist - it shall also have place free of charge for youngsters.
About me? Art & Design is my life, it does goes to the shore of writing a lot, but we all have our perks, don't we? Alongside me there's my husband, Oleg (He says that there is a great way of pronouncing his name right "Oh! Leg" - goes best at getting his name right.), the person of mighty brains - the document wiz and psychology mage!
We're a geeky couple - being all cuddly about gaming/animation/comic books/manga/great books and some crazy TV shows, and we wish to add it up in our cafe. Because it's purely awesome!
Yet we care about community in here, about the kids and young adults who're having no place for them to grow freely, indulge in sciences and arts they wish to be a part of. So we really want to change that.
Much Love,

Anastasija

 

We have the youth waiting 

Before this project began we went through a bit of length to gather up teens and young adults.
I have asked them about the places they go to - they all stated that local cafes are expensive, the centre for kids is costly, so they mainly stay at home. Otherwise they "chill" outside wandering around town. They literally have no place to be in if it's not home. Although there were complaints about home being quite a tough place to be as well.
So I decided to just round them up and take them out to places that would be less costly and available for us to be in. Still, they have to pay for their time there, which is sad.
But still, when they attend - they have the fun of their life chatting and playing music, terrorizing Xbox, having long chats and plainly smiling and laughing. That's what I wish to accomplish - their smiling faces, radiant, bright and enjoying life.


 

 

 

Summary

This project is about combining community, art and coffee. Great main objective is to make youth centre for teens, kids and young adults that is totally free.

This centre will have facilities for kids to study programs on computers that are hard to get even in schools; they will have photography\filming room, dance studio, book stands with literature in English, Russian, Lithuanian and many other languages for youth to advance their knowledge and attain more practice in their studies. Game room will be included with Xbox, PS4 and board games. There will be a kitchen corner with coffee machine, tea and snacks, so that they’ll have something to refill them during their productive time.

To keep everything free for them – the café downstairs will be using percentage from sales to upkeep centre. This centre is aimed for kids and young adults to have place for them to grow, additionally providing information and help to them.

Not many are lucky to have pocket money, so they can’t spend time for fun or pay for extra classes they wish to indulge in, or learn things because payment is essential to many.
I wish to have enough programs, information and possibilities available so they can learn languages, use professional software for film, design, music, animation, photography and many more.
There will be teachers coming in to give lectures for free, psychologist and social worker visiting to help them in need.

Government does not provide enough for youth, so we wish to change that, we wish to help youth see world brighter, grow confident in skills and abilities, see everything differently and become change of this contemporary world.

Café will host customers with love and care. It will have sandwich stand with homemade sandwiches and baguettes, hot sandwiches included. Also as a “personification” in addition, Café will include homemade sweets: cheesecakes, muffins, croissants, cakes and many more.

Some sweets will be made in idea related or influenced by movies, games, anime, comic books, books and manga. To enrich the experience there will be seasonal and event themed food, that will be served. It will be related to different cultures and influences.

We decided to create events like “stand up” nights, “live music” events with musicians that are local as well as from different countries, also the “battles” between the Make-up/Hair/Nails stylists, Designers and Artisans, Fashion Shows will be included too, as they’ll mostly be hosted once every 3-4 months. Such events will mainly be free for anyone to attend and see (In some cases we’ll have a 2-3 euro fee for entry – which will add up to prize pool of winner, depending on event).

Participants will have a great set of prizes for their work and contributions. Rewards such as flight for a week to holiday destination, special café card with options of free food for certain period of time, special events created specifically for the winner, online promotions and much more.

One of the most “magical” workshops/events hosted shall be food based. Consumers will be able to create desserts or gourmet food with help of Chef and Café Staff. Chefs that will participate in such events/lessons will be mainly from abroad, so that food will be as authentic as possible.
Such events will encourage youth and grown-ups to try new ways in cooking and enjoy time spent learning something new.

This sort of events will engage consumers in more art diversity and will show them the differences and wide range of interests that cover art world.

As a slight perk of Shutter Tea Café – there will always be some sort of exhibition going on inside: paintings/photography/digital design art pieces hanging on the walls, 3D art bits here and there.
One main thing that will be available only here will be the special merchandise with plush toys, keyrings and other bits that are replicas of our seasonal and thematic sweets and food.
This merchandise will help maintain youth centre.

With all this going on we still will maintain the airy feel inside, so the atmosphere won’t be clustered up, in some cases like overdose of furniture or any other items compilation – we won’t have that. We shall keep it modern and easy acceptable. So that customers will feel at ease, able to relax, enjoy their stay and share the experience.

 

Why so much?

We do know that the amount we request is ginormous, yet there is a good reason for that as well – place that we selected is in more than critical condition. It is abandoned for years, but it is in a nice spot that is accessible to most by being in the middle if the town.




This place looks like something out of the horror movie on the inside with no flooring, sacks of sand from who knows when, it is all clustered up inside with builders rubbish and needs a tear-down and full restructure. (and this is where the amount is so high)
This place is quite costly, even though it's in such condition. Then the restructure work will follow - which will also take up quite the amount.
Then the needed technology and furniture - which will be less in cost than the building and all its perks.

The goal is to make it a cafe for first two floors and two floors of Youth Centre and exhibition gallery.
 

The Cause


The Centre will be a great platform for youth to get more knowledge, get information, consultation and help, furthermore - it will be a place for them to be. Right now there are no free places for kids and young adults to stay in this town. Local government funded centres are costly, many can't afford it.
I wish to make it for them. I want them to have somewhere to be. I know how hard it is to come from below average sort of family. It's tough, it's hard, you count each cent, you do your best, yet not always there are people to admire your hard work, reward you or give you chances to manifest yourself even further. For this cause I really want the local youth to have everything for them to become what they wish to become, or for some - to find themselves.

Cafe can greatly help maintain the life of centre. Also it will allow kids to try out work there as part-timers if they wish to get work experience within catering.

With many events that we will host - we'll widen the sights of kids. They'll see that art has more to it, that there are so many other great things about each work. Doing our best - we'll see to young adults and kids to have mentors in their selected career path.

We're just a cafe that really cares and wishes to change the community, that wants to make the difference.

 

Risks 

For what we see - there are none. Construction will not take too long.
Legal matters are all easy to deal with. All prep paper work for the project was done and we just need the final step to be accomplished - funding.

So that customers will feel at ease, able to relax, enjoy their stay and share the experience. Why so much?We do know that the amount we request is ginormous, yet there is a good reason for that as well – place that we selected is in more than critical condition. It is abandoned for years, but it is in a nice spot that is accessible to most by being in the middle if the town.This place looks like something out of the horror movie on the inside with no flooring, sacks of sand from who knows when, it is all clustered up inside with builders rubbish and needs a tear-down and full restructure. (and this is where the amount is so high)This place is quite costly, even though it's in such condition. Then the restructure work will follow - which will also take up quite the amount.Then the needed technology and furniture - which will be less in cost than the building and all its perks.The goal is to make it a cafe for first two floors and two floors of Youth Centre and exhibition gallery. The CauseThe Centre will be a great platform for youth to get more knowledge, get information, consultation and help, furthermore - it will be a place for them to be. Right now there are no free places for kids and young adults to stay in this town. Local government funded centres are costly, many can't afford it.I wish to make it for them. I want them to have somewhere to be. I know how hard it is to come from below average sort of family. It's tough, it's hard, you count each cent, you do your best, yet not always there are people to admire your hard work, reward you or give you chances to manifest yourself even further. For this cause I really want the local youth to have everything for them to become what they wish to become, or for some - to find themselves.Cafe can greatly help maintain the life of centre. Also it will allow kids to try out work there as part-timers if they wish to get work experience within catering.With many events that we will host - we'll widen the sights of kids. They'll see that art has more to it, that there are so many other great things about each work. Doing our best - we'll see to young adults and kids to have mentors in their selected career path.We're just a cafe that really cares and wishes to change the community, that wants to make the difference. Risks For what we see - there are none. Construction will not take too long.Legal matters are all easy to deal with. All prep paper work for the project was done and we just need the final step to be accomplished - funding.

story:
The Short Summary: I was born to JAM

The long answer lies in those moments when you taste something so delicious that you instinctually pause the moment it hits your tastebuds.  Those moments when that flavor passes right through your tongue directly into your soul, making your eyes roll into the back of your head. Making you inhale immediately and deeply, only to let it out a slow, satisfied sigh as the corners of your mouth turn upward into a smile. Those are the moments I live for. And those are the moments I jam for.

Creating That’s My Jam is a calling home for me in many ways. I’ve always enjoyed farming, fresh produce, and making delicious food to share with people, and that’s exactly what That’s My Jam is all about. I grew up in rural Pennsylvania both farming and preserving food since before I can remember.  I moved to New York City over six years ago and while my farming and preserving was put on hold, I was exposed to new cuisines and complex layering of flavors that have made their way into my jams.

It was a happy accident that I got back into making jams. One summer when I was about to head out to a berry patch to pick, I realized I had a few jars of jam from the previous year that I was never going to finish them myself. I shared them with others, and everyone raved about them, saying it was the best jam they've ever tasted because it wasn't overly sweet and the flavor of the fruit was the star. At the time I was working at an Afternoon Tea Salon on the Lower East Side, and the owner said I should make jam to be served with tea. Before I knew it, I had a small jam business growing and That's My Jam was born.

What We Need 

We're looking to raise $1500, which will cover:

  • That's My Farm, a berry garden that will provide all the delicious fruit once it's reached maturity
  • Jars, Labels, Pectin, Website fees
  • Legal fees to be able to sell online rather than just farmer's markets

Non-Monetary ways you can help, which are equally as helpful:

  • Introductions to owners of farmer's market stands who would be interested in selling my jam
  • Donate your overabundance of fruit from the tree in your back yard if you have one
  • TO TRY IT! Seriously. I need you to know how amazing this stuff is.
  • Share this campaigns with your friends.

What You Get

  • Jam, which equals infinite pleasure and happiness
  • To have a positive impact on the Earth by supporting a woman whose main goal is to take care of Mother Earth through sustainable farming practices and beekeeping (read The Impact for more info)
  • ALL THE GLORY
  • infinite thanks and gratitude, as well as a special place in my heart

The Impact

In addition to spreading pleasure and happiness, you will also be supporting local agriculture and earth-friendly farming processes. 

While experimenting with jam recipes and flavor combinations, I learned that the secret to exquisite jams is to use exquisite fruit. There’s nothing like a fresh berry picked at peak ripeness. No matter how hard a person tries, they can’t recreate the perfection Mother Nature has already produced. That’s why I never try to outsmart her. I simply let her be my inspiration and guide. I simply want to showcase her beauty through jam.

With this realization, I saw an opportunity for That’s My Jam to not only be about creating mouth-watering jams, but also to use it as a platform to learn more about and implement earth-friendly farming practices and eventually beekeeping and composting. Mother Earth needs people caring for her more than ever, so the heart of That’s My Jam is to be a spokesperson for Mother Earth through sharing how to care for the planet and also showcasing her beauty through exquisitely crafted jams.  These two things combined created my vision for the growth of That’s My Jam. 

Risks & Challenges

Really there are none. I'm going to keep doing this no matter what, but it would certainly be easier if you helped out.

story:
Hello Friends, 

Two United States Army veterans are launching a new food truck in the Dallas, Texas Fort Worth area. After a long period of planning, they are ready to get started on their new journey.  

Let me paint you a picture. 

The founders Stephane and Narmary met while they were serving as Army cooks in 2010. Their idea for a truck stop restaurant came shortly after they were married.  

Here is the best part: 

Since they are both from the Caribbean, they are creating a one-of-a-kind menu. 

You see, their vision is to combine delicious Caribbean spices along with Latin flavors to provide many of the popular dishes they are excited to serve in Dallas.

The menu will feature unique Haitian and Puerto Rican food concept.  

How You Can Support Veterans And Local Entrepreneurs At The Same Time! 

A portion of this campaign will go toward a non-profit charity for Veterans. The founders Stephane and Narmary want to pay homage to the armed forces which did so much for them. 

The money donated to charity will help veterans in need in the Dallas, Fort Worth area. With this intention, we would like to help the Veterans who sadly been affected by drugs, homelessness, and injuries. 

How We are Going To Help Our Community: 

Our new food truck will combine the great flavors of the Caribbean and Latin cuisine creating a totally unique food truck experience.

A percentage of our monthly sales will go towards helping our Veterans through local charity.

Our truck will allow us to cater to special events, as well as working within our community

And much more!

We need your help to get our new food truck properly equipped. Altogether, we need to be outfitted with a fully functional kitchen, truck wrap and point of sale software. 

Thank You For Supporting Taste Of Successs! 

Every single contribution will help make our big dream and turn it into reality. As long-term food service workers, the founders always desired about opening their own mobile restaurant.

This campaign will bring them one step toward their ultimate business goal – a fully functional food truck. A food truck will give them the unique opportunity to host exclusive events, as well as post up wherever they are. 

Support the Taste Of Successs Today – let’s bring great food to the streets of Dallas, Fort Worth.  Help us get the word out by sharing our campaign with your friends and family.  Let's make some noise about Taste of Successs campaign......

Thank you for your generosity. 

Until next time, Just remember Success comes in many flavors

The Taste Of Successs Team

P.S. A portion of this campaign (and our sales as a business) will go toward a local Veteran non-profit charity.

story:
Our Story

Mon Macaron started with a Kitchenaid Mixer and a dream. Two moms (Autumn and Brittany) started this company and operate every aspect of it while balancing motherhood with six kids between their families. In five short months, Mon Macaron has grown exponentially and introduced a unique and sensational new offering: hand airbrushed corporate logo macarons.

With this new technique, Mon Macaron has taken on corporate clients for gifts and events! Our hope is to expand this portion of our business as edible branding is a popular and fun way to show off a company logo or brand.

We have no background in pastry nor are we chefs or attended pasty school. We are 100% self-taught and perfected this advanced technique of macaron making. Old fashioned hard work and perseverance has allowed us to double and then triple sales, ending 2019 with five-figure sales accomplishments! 

The reason for this campaign is spreading the love of macarons with nationwide shipping and reaching our local communities with a retail location. Funding from this campaign will help us achieve both of those goals with 1) new equipment that allows us to create, store, and decorate macarons and 2) fund build-out and equipment costs for our first micro-retail location in Raleigh-Durham.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for help with $500 or more of our expenses. This will go directly to:

  • Our first month of rent at our micro-retail location in Raleigh-Durham

  • Avantco BCC-48-HC 48" White Refrigerated Countertop Bakery Display Case with LED Lighting

  • The Ink Edibles CakePro 750a

  • Bakon USA DropTT Depositor

For believing in us as a backer for this campaign you will receive, dependant on the amount pledged:

  • A dozen of our most popular macaron flavors shipped to you
  • A subscription for a monthly surprise macaron box
  • A professional image of Mon Macarons to print or use as a background
  • Our love and appreciation
  • A macaron on us when we open our first location!

The Impact

The impact of helping us at this critical time in our small business venture is believing in small businesses, handcrafted products, small-batch delicious baked goods, and most importantly the two moms who opened this business to teach our kids the value of hard work and dedication.

The community will be impacted by a macaron business because it will help the local economy and employ countless others in the community. We plan to partner with local pasty programs and community college foodservice programs to employ young people ready to learn a new skill.

Risks & Challenges

As two previously stay-at-home moms, we did not start this business with any funding or loans. We are a 100% cash positive business and have organically grown our sales to several thousand per month as a brand new business starting in August 2019. We built this company on our own with minimal overhead and the challenge with growth is that we have to find creative ways to fund expansion. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, please share our story and our macarons! 

 

Thank you for believing in us and this business! Here's to an amazing 2020!

story:
​sol & NOVA 

sol & NOVA LLC is founded by Vern Kittler and Natalie Meiselwitz. Vern has been a tattoo artist for the past 10+ years and is a manager of Greenseed Studios located in Sheboygan. Natalie is currently the sous chef at BoMallies here in Sheboygan. Vern and Natalie decided that creating sol & NOVA together would be a way to combine two worlds into one business. Natalie will provide food and drink service during the day hours of sol & NOVA and Vern will use his years of experience playing music and creating art to make a music venue at night. sol & NOVA will also be a safe haven for artists in our community; we want to offer a place for local artists to come and create or to sell their art/products. We want sol & NOVA to become a local hub for artists, musicians, and any and everyone who enjoys the fine arts. 

sol & NOVA LLC is an innovative, artistic, inviting, and safe cafe that turns into an 21+ music-based nightclub located straight in the center of the City of Sheboygan. We plan to entice and quite frankly shock Sheboygan with offering them an experience that is quite unfamiliar and entirely unique to the area. Sheboygan is encompassed with bars and with an entire drinking lifestyle and we plan to break that cycle by supplying something new. Sol” the cafe portion of sol & NOVA will offer alcohol free drinks such as specialty cold brews, coffees, teas, kombucha, and a variety of other drink options. The cafe will include an innovative and modern approach on classic cafe foods, we aim to offer variety while still having an approachable menu. The goal of “sol” is to provide our customers with natural, organic, sustainable, and locally sourced products at an affordable price. We are going to bring an accessibility to organic, local produce that Sheboygan has yet to see from other local cafes and restaurants, all while doing it in an inventive, creative, and ultimately flavorful way. What will truly set sol & NOVA apart from other local hotspots will be the fact that our brand of entertainment will be solely focused on the talent of the musicians we bring in and the ambient environment we tend to create. We aspire to combine two worlds by having “sol” be a relaxed cafe, a very chill environment during the days conducive to business meetings or students studying; then flipping the switch and becoming an 21+ nightclub, “NOVA”, offering live music and an environment that won’t be solely focused on alcohol in order to have a good night. NOVA will provide a nightlife experience to Sheboygan that this city has yet to ever witness. We will have a perfectly tuned and large Personal Audio system equipped with Martin subwoofers, a choreographed visual, lighting, and laser experience in an ambient atmosphere. 

 

What We Need and What You Get 

For our project, we are completing a series of large renovations in the space. One of the largest expenses in our budget is the electrical for the building, being an expense around $20,000 alone. We are doing a complete overhaul of the outdoor space, providing ample outdoor seating, really

giving the space the curb appeal that it currently lacks, and updating and securing the property line with a multifunctional barrier wall and outdoor bar top. We aim to create an outdoor space that we can utilize as many months of the year as possible with added outdoor heaters. Outdoor renovations are projected to cost around $7,500. From there, we move into the indoor space. The space inside will be getting a fresh coat of paint and will have a custom built stage that encompasses six Martin Subwoofers. The stage will also be multifunctional, so when it is not a stage, it will hold a display case for various bakery items and pre-packaged foods for patrons on-the-go. The cafe will be equipped with an espresso machine, drip coffee machines and warmers, juicers, ice machine, hot water heater, ect. Projected indoor costs will be around $15,000. The space also has the potential for a kitchen in an adjoining room that will have a cut out/walkway into the main dining space. All projected kitchen equipment and installation costs will be around $25,000. All together our budget for this project will be around $67,500. With that being said, we are reaching out to the community for support and for a contribution into a business that plans to better our city. We want to bring life back to a place that sits on one of the busiest streets filled with small businesses and with a reputation for a nightlife. We want the people in our city to be a part of this project, because we are ultimately doing it for all of you. We are asking for support so we are able to open the best version of sol & NOVA that we can envision; and by contributing, you are helping us open our doors. For us, this is about more than just opening a business, it's about creating a soulful and sustainable establishment for our family and the community for years to come. We look forward to serving you and seeing you at sol & NOVA. 

 

The Perks for Contributing 

$0-24- thank you for your contribution! Every little bit helps 

$25- a lovely cup of our finest coffee with your first visit!

$50-  one cup of coffee and a complimentary bakery item!

$100- 4-pack of tickets to our first event!

$250- the first 30 days of operation, coffee is on us!

$500- your name goes into the concrete in our courtyard. Your name will forever be in stone as one who had a hand in the creation of sol & NOVA. 

$750- you get a menu item named after you and every time you order it, it’s 50% off!

your name goes into the concrete in our courtyard. Your name will forever be in stone as one who had a hand in the creation of sol & NOVA. 

$1,000- For one month of your choice, coffee is on us and you get 10 free bakery items!

Your name goes into concrete in our courtyard. Your name will forever be in stone as one who had a hand in the creation of sol & NOVA 

$1000-**Business Package**- We will post your business on our projector throughout our business hours along with announcing that all events thrown at sol & NOVA will be sponsored by your business for 30 days.

Business name/owner name goes into the concrete in our courtyard, signifying your contribution towards the foundation of sol & NOVA

$2,000- **Business Package**- For two months we will have your business cards at our register for patrons and your business gets 20 coffee coupons valid for a regular coffee or an espresso drink 

Business name/owner name goes into the concrete in our courtyard, signifying your contribution towards the foundation of sol & NOVA

$3000-**Business Package**- We will post your business on our projector throughout our business hours along with announcing that all events thrown at sol & NOVA will be sponsored by your business for 60 days.

Business name/owner name goes into the concrete in our courtyard, signifying your contribution towards the foundation of sol & NOVA

$5000- ** Business Package**- for two months we will have your business cards at our register for patrons and your business gets 20 coffee coupons valid for a regular coffee or an espresso drink 

We will post your business on our projector throughout our business hours along with announcing that all events thrown at sol & NOVA will be sponsored by your business for 60 days.

Business name/owner name goes into the concrete in our courtyard, signifying your contribution towards the foundation of sol & NOVA

$10,000- **Business Package**- Our first sol & NOVA music festival will be co-sponsored by your business We will post your business on our projector throughout our business hours along with announcing that all events thrown at sol & NOVA will be sponsored by your business for 60 days.

Business name/owner name goes into the concrete in our courtyard, signifying your contribution towards the foundation of sol & NOVA

The Impact 

Your contribution will make a HUGE difference for us. The more funds we get, the better service and atmosphere we can provide and the more stable our business will be financially. Our guarantee to you is simple: every coffee, espresso drink or meal you get at sol & NOVA will be consistently the best, served in an ambient and inclusive atmosphere. Besides providing you with an excellent coffee and cafe experience, we think that our business can help towards the revamp that our city is currently under. We want this area to come alive, and if that's going to happen it will need businesses like ours and people like you to make it happen. We want to thank you in advance for your help towards making our vision for sol & NOVA come to life. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Anything helps! We appreciate your donations as well as your support. Please post this anywhere and everywhere. Tell your friends and family and help us make this a major community effort.Indiegogo makes it easy to share. Check out the share tools to help us spread the word.

giving the space the curb appeal that it currently lacks, and updating and securing the property line with a multifunctional barrier wall and outdoor bar top. We aim to create an outdoor space that we can utilize as many months of the year as possible with added outdoor heaters. Outdoor renovations are projected to cost around $7,500. From there, we move into the indoor space. The space inside will be getting a fresh coat of paint and will have a custom built stage that encompasses six Martin Subwoofers. The stage will also be multifunctional, so when it is not a stage, it will hold a display case for various bakery items and pre-packaged foods for patrons on-the-go. The cafe will be equipped with an espresso machine, drip coffee machines and warmers, juicers, ice machine, hot water heater, ect. Projected indoor costs will be around $15,000. The space also has the potential for a kitchen in an adjoining room that will have a cut out/walkway into the main dining space. All projected kitchen equipment and installation costs will be around $25,000. All together our budget for this project will be around $67,500. With that being said, we are reaching out to the community for support and for a contribution into a business that plans to better our city. We want to bring life back to a place that sits on one of the busiest streets filled with small businesses and with a reputation for a nightlife. We want the people in our city to be a part of this project, because we are ultimately doing it for all of you. We are asking for support so we are able to open the best version of sol & NOVA that we can envision; and by contributing, you are helping us open our doors. For us, this is about more than just opening a business, it's about creating a soulful and sustainable establishment for our family and the community for years to come. We look forward to serving you and seeing you at sol & NOVA.  The Perks for Contributing 
$0-24- thank you for your contribution! Every little bit helps 
$25- a lovely cup of our finest coffee with your first visit!
$50-  one cup of coffee and a complimentary bakery item!
$100- 4-pack of tickets to our first event!
$250- the first 30 days of operation, coffee is on us!
$500- your name goes into the concrete in our courtyard. Your name will forever be in stone as one who had a hand in the creation of sol & NOVA. 
$750- you get a menu item named after you and every time you order it, it’s 50% off!
your name goes into the concrete in our courtyard. Your name will forever be in stone as one who had a hand in the creation of sol & NOVA. 
$1,000- For one month of your choice, coffee is on us and you get 10 free bakery items!
Your name goes into concrete in our courtyard. Your name will forever be in stone as one who had a hand in the creation of sol & NOVA 
$1000-**Business Package**- We will post your business on our projector throughout our business hours along with announcing that all events thrown at sol & NOVA will be sponsored by your business for 30 days.
Business name/owner name goes into the concrete in our courtyard, signifying your contribution towards the foundation of sol & NOVA
$2,000- **Business Package**- For two months we will have your business cards at our register for patrons and your business gets 20 coffee coupons valid for a regular coffee or an espresso drink 
Business name/owner name goes into the concrete in our courtyard, signifying your contribution towards the foundation of sol & NOVA
$3000-**Business Package**- We will post your business on our projector throughout our business hours along with announcing that all events thrown at sol & NOVA will be sponsored by your business for 60 days.
Business name/owner name goes into the concrete in our courtyard, signifying your contribution towards the foundation of sol & NOVA
$5000- ** Business Package**- for two months we will have your business cards at our register for patrons and your business gets 20 coffee coupons valid for a regular coffee or an espresso drink 
We will post your business on our projector throughout our business hours along with announcing that all events thrown at sol & NOVA will be sponsored by your business for 60 days.
Business name/owner name goes into the concrete in our courtyard, signifying your contribution towards the foundation of sol & NOVA
$10,000- **Business Package**- Our first sol & NOVA music festival will be co-sponsored by your business We will post your business on our projector throughout our business hours along with announcing that all events thrown at sol & NOVA will be sponsored by your business for 60 days.
Business name/owner name goes into the concrete in our courtyard, signifying your contribution towards the foundation of sol & NOVA
The Impact 
Your contribution will make a HUGE difference for us. The more funds we get, the better service and atmosphere we can provide and the more stable our business will be financially. Our guarantee to you is simple: every coffee, espresso drink or meal you get at sol & NOVA will be consistently the best, served in an ambient and inclusive atmosphere. Besides providing you with an excellent coffee and cafe experience, we think that our business can help towards the revamp that our city is currently under. We want this area to come alive, and if that's going to happen it will need businesses like ours and people like you to make it happen. We want to thank you in advance for your help towards making our vision for sol & NOVA come to life.  Other Ways You Can Help
Anything helps! We appreciate your donations as well as your support. Please post this anywhere and everywhere. Tell your friends and family and help us make this a major community effort.Indiegogo makes it easy to share. Check out the share tools to help us spread the word.

story:
Us, Beer, And The World

We are Alex and Kelsey Watley, a husband and wife team that started brewing beer together in the very early stages of our relationship. In an odd way, we've found that beer is an integral part of our lives; We make it, we search for it, and it's there for some of our best memories with friends. Chances are, if you're here, you feel similar. 

We want to taste the best beer brewers in this country have to offer, and we want to share those experiences with people that appreciate good beer. What better way to do that than a subscription box?

Treat yourself to a very competitively priced, private Craft Beer Club, that will send a minimum of 72ozs of beer- a variety of tastes from independent breweries- right to your door. We'll also occasionally throw in little gifts, because we like it when you're happy. 

Help Us Help You

We are looking for $10,000, which will go towards two primary things: licensing and, well, beer. Licensing is important because it allows us to access the best beers and deliver them right to you, unhindered. The money will cover the licensing fee in our birth place, Washington D.C. as well as the shipping licenses that some states require. The rest will cover the fun stuff, beer, as well as the unique beer accessories that we'll be featuring in some of our Rebel Boxes.

Money is not the only thing we need though. YOU are our most important asset. This campaign is the ONLY place to get the first 100 subscriptions that we're releasing. We call the club private because we can only open up a few member slots at a time. Open, fluid membership would mean large amounts of inventory on hand, which tends to lead to flat or stale beer. To make sure that the beer that comes to you is fresh and as close to tap room quality as possible, we keep our membership limited. So, right here, on Indiegogo, is the ONLY place to get the first 100 membership slots available. Remember- members also get discounts at our online bottle shop, which will hold rare, high end craft beer that comes in only the smallest quantities.  

If we don't reach our goal, all is not lost! Our priority will still be licensing, but we've made sure that we'll have the money to cover every single member that wants a piece of this delicious beer pie. Again, YOU are really what we're looking for; People to create a craft beer connection with, so the entire country can be a giant, local, craft beer community. 

The Tap Rebellion

So why is this a rebellion? Well, I won't go too far into the boring stuff, but essentially, the liquor laws in this country are leftover from prohibition. No, not entirely. Obviously alcohol is legal now, but is that all we should be happy about? Big Beer- corporate beer- controls the laws that govern breweries, and Craft beer is getting big! This means that a lot of micro-breweries get swallowed up, or even bullied out of existence. We want to help these Micro-Breweries get connected with people all over the country that may never have even heard about them! We want to get these independent crafters exposed to potential new fans! They've already rebelled by standing in the face of the giant corporate beer companies and saying they've had enough of bland, watery, beer. We just want to fuel the fire of the rebellion, and help you join too!

Challenges; Or, Are We Bootleggers?

There are two main challenges that we have foreseen. One is shipping. Some states are a fun party-time free for all (yay Florida!) and there will be no problems getting beer to them. Others aren't quite so awesome, and we'll need to go through the proper channels to get shipping licenses from them. And others, well, they just flat out say no (boo Utah!). For those of you in the 'boo' states, we are very sorry, there's nothing we can do for you, and we really don't want to get shut down, fined, or thrown in prison. Our doughy beer physiques can't handle it. The good news is, laws change all the time! We're constantly monitoring the laws and we'll let you know IMMEDIATELY when we can open up membership to you.

States We CANNOT Ship To:

  • Arkansas
  • Alabama
  • Illinois
  • Indiana
  • Kentucky
  • Maine
  • Massachusetts
  • Maryland
  • Michigan
  • Minnesota
  • Missouri
  • New Jersey
  • New York
  • New Mexico
  • Oklahoma
  • Rhode Island
  • South Dakota
  • Tennessee
  • Texas
  • Utah
  • Washington

For everyone else- kanpai! 

The second challenge is the breweries themselves. The very nature of nano and micro-breweries is that they don't distribute very much. Some do, and we can easily find them in very small, local wholesalers to get them out to you. Some even distribute for themselves, and we can grab a few hundred bottles, cans, or crowlers directly from their tap room. Others, well...they don't distribute at all. They've got kegs, taps, and growler fill ups, but often no way to bottle or can. But we still want relationships with these breweries! That's why one of our plans, if we get over our fundraising goals, is to invest in a canning machine. That way, even if it's just for limited runs, we can help these smaller (but equally delicious) breweries get the exposure they deserve.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, fear not! There are still ways to help the rebellion. You can follow us on social media (@taprebels), you can tell all your beer lovin' friends about us, you can keep us in mind for gifts and special occasions, and you can share this campaign with everyone you know! 

 The best way you can help us? Nominate your favorite breweries to us! Go to www.taprebels.com and put some names in the Suggestion Box. I'm sure your favorite breweries would love to hear that you're thinking about them ;)

story:
How We Came to Be

I grew up in the Chicago and southern Wisconsin area with great cheesecake. I learned to bake when I was just 4 years old. As a young girl, I spent time in 3rd world countries and upon returning to the USA I knew that one day I wanted a life of giving back. I started Muddy Paws Cheesecake in 1992. 26 years later, we are still in business in the same city where I started it: St Louis Park, Minnesota! We make 222 flavors of cheesecake and we do work with many local charities. Each year we also put on cheesecake sampling event which brings in hundreds of toys and pounds of food for our charity partners: Step Emergency Program & Perspectives Family. Last year, we were an accidental target of a burglary which damaged most of our bakery. The public came thru to help us rebuild! To give them a better place to come to and to put that experience behind us, we moved to a new location mid-January 2019.

What We Need & What You Get

To be able to bake, we must contract a licensed professional to install a gas line & hook up for our oven. We are borrowing an electric oven (once our sinks are put in!), which has limited capacity. Our gas oven, once hooked up, will allow us to bake in the volume needed to be able to keep up with production. We are also wanting to create a community space for gatherings, meetings and co-working! This is a needed affordable option in our community and it will be offered at a discounted rate to our cheesecake customers. We need help with costs of that remodeling. 

The Indiegogo funds will be broken down accordingly:

$3,000 for Gas Install/Hook Up

$5,000 for Community Space (paint/carpet/furniture)

Any extra funds will go towards helping pay back the loan taken out to cover expenses of the moving truck + expenses paid for paint/flooring/furniture/ceiling tiles/signage/marketing materials and lighting in our retail area (which is done!).

What you will get is your name on a wall plaque in the community meeting space, which will be the We Built This Cheesecake wall! You will also get to attend a private party just for our investors, where will have cheesecake, live music and some surprise perks handed out! All who donate over $40, will get a "We Built This Cheesecake" T-Shirt! (You may buy a t-shirt or extra t-shirts, at cost, as well. Link will be provided here soon.)

*The celebration party will be early April, 2019.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us share this campaign:

  • Share on social media and on email.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools! Post a photo with the link so it is viewed more.

THANK YOU all for helping to Build This Cheesecake!

story:
The Plug is an anti-hangover drink that has 13 herbal plants and flowers that were carefully selected after years of research and development and millions of dollars invested not only in the proprietary formula, but also in the proprietary state-of-the-art distillation process.

 

 

Don't forget to spread the love on Facebook :)

 

Directions

Start Your Night

 

"Plug In"

 

Keep Partying!

 

Wake Up Refreshed 

 

 

See The Plug from Start to Finish

Check out all the behind the scenes footage of how The Plug gets made!

 
 

Testimonials

Check out what people are saying about The Plug!

 

 

Don't forget to spread the love on Facebook!

 

THE RESULTS

After months of testing, here's what our team of PhD professors discovered when you take The Plug after a night out:

 

Nutrition Facts

What's inside The Plug!

Perks & Rewards

What you'll get when you pre-order The Plug!

 

 

Everyone deserves The Plug in their life - sharing is caring!

 

 

Timeline

Check out how far we've come!

 

About Us

Natives of Los Angeles, Ray and Justin, also known as The Kim Bros, grew up in a cultural melting pot where diversity, entrepreneurship, and fame all co-existed together. Raised in an entrepreneurial household, Ray and Justin were inherently curious and always coming up with new business ventures. From a young age, The Kim Bros were always together and still do everything together, challenging and improving each other in sports or in school. Both got recruited to play collegiate baseball and always have been very health focused. Ray received his Bachelors of Arts from The University of Chicago and Justin received his Bachelors of Arts from Northwestern University. With a work hard, play hard mentality both Ray and Justin began seeking a healthier alternative to boost productivity to support their lifestyle choices. And it wasn’t until three years ago, when Ray moved back to Los Angeles that the foundation of The Plug began.

The Kim Bros saw that there was a growing demand for a hangover solution, but a limited supply of truly effective hangover recovery products available. This imbalance was an opportunity to bring a proven alternative from Korea and share it with the U.S. consumers. The result? Together, The Kim Bros created The Plug. 

The Plug differentiates itself from all other anti-hangover drinks in two ways: our proprietary formula and our unbeatable taste. The Plug has 13 herbal plants and flowers that were carefully selected after years of research and development and millions of dollars invested not only in the proprietary formula, but also in the proprietary state-of-the-art distillation process. For The Plug’s fantastic flavor, Ray and Justin honed down the taste for 8 months going back and forth with Korea to make sure it would be the best in the market. With clinical research studies done by teams of PhD professors, this further reiterates that the proof is in The Plug. 

This is where The Kim Bros mission of creating the perfect recovery drink began, and how The Plug evolved from concept to reality. In a journey that has spanned years, countries, and continents -  The Plug was created so that everyone can enjoy drinking without having to worry about the next day. Because no matter how active you are or how hard you work, everyone needs a night out now and again. So Plug In and Welcome to The Plug Life!

- The Kim Bros

story:
Can we bake enough Cake to Move to the Lake?

A question I asked Becky and before the brow raise I proposed a quick business plan.

Practice making cake balls & petits fours -> Raise donations ->  Gain feedback -> Buy a lake property to open up a shop and to live on. 

 

Entrepreneur of Many, Billions with None

From Reusable Greeting Cards to Sauces for Wings, and let's not forget the Caulk-man Figurines! My latest adventure in cake balling led me to create a cross between a cake ball and a petit four. Trust, I have accepted that I will never be a billionaire but what I can do is ask that you support my Entrepreneurial Addiction.  

Just in case you are still reading and wondered

Reuseable greeting card?     https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k08r082PNuY

OR

CaulkMan?      www.caulkmen.blogspot.com  or  https://www.facebook.com/caulkman 

 

The Goal

To raise enough to quit our jobs and buy a storefront on a lakefront in Indiana /Ohio/Michigan area. Isn't this everyone's dream?

Either way, tell everyone you know how silly or great you think this is. Please!

 

Favorite Lakes

Big Long Lake in Indiana

Klinger Lake in Michigan

Lake George in Indiana and Michigan

Grand Lake St. Mary's in Ohio

story:
Sovda was launched just 6 months ago here on Indiegogo.

We are so thankful for all the support and how the Specialty coffee industry has supported our first product.  

Our most requested item from our Pearl Mini Customers was a 

  • Destoner that didn’t take up so much space
  • Dust elimination
  • Adjustable hopper 
  • Stainless steel loader 

That is the challenge we gave our design team and the result is the Sovda lift.  It is the first loader designed for the specialty coffee industry with a destoner built in.  

What makes it special:

  • High speed opening and closing of the outlet
  • Adjustable legs so that it can even been recessed in concrete for roasters with low outlets
  • All food grade stainless steel
  • Beautiful sight glass

​We have finalized our prototype and manufacturing and just need to raise $25,000 to place our first order.  

With specialty coffee roasters in mind, our equipment is made to integrate with 15 to 90kg capacity roasters. We’ve experienced the pain points of specialty roasters, lack of equipment to meet their needs and made solutions with better design and technology. Sovda machines are made to be aesthetically pleasing and simple to use. Our products have been developed     and tested with the Torch Coffee Research & Development Lab. The Pearl Mini, Sovda Lift and Precision Fill are designed to seamlessly integrate into the existing operations of Specialty Coffee Roasters. Not only did we apply smart technology and elegant Scandinavian design principles to the specific requirements of specialty roasters, we designed our supply chain and manufacturing model to offer quality workmanship backed by fanatical support, at a price specialty roasters can afford.      

 

    The Impact

    Specialty coffee roasters do the important work of supporting coffee farmers by purchasing coffee at a higher price. Sovda was launched to support the specialty coffee roaster in this endeavor.

    Our first product, the Pearl Mini, was launched on Indiegogo last August. It is now operating in Onyx Coffee Lab,  and the Muddle Me showroom in Dubai.
story_txt:
Sovda was launched just 6 months ago here on Indiegogo.
We are so thankful for all the support and how the Specialty coffee industry has supported our first product.  
Our most requested item from our Pearl Mini Customers was a 

Destoner that didn’t take up so much space
Dust elimination
Adjustable hopper 
Stainless steel loader 

That is the challenge we gave our design team and the result is the Sovda lift.  It is the first loader designed for the specialty coffee industry with a destoner built in.  
What makes it special:

High speed opening and closing of the outlet
Adjustable legs so that it can even been recessed in concrete for roasters with low outlets
All food grade stainless steel
Beautiful sight glass

​We have finalized our prototype and manufacturing and just need to raise $25,000 to place our first order.  
With specialty coffee roasters in mind, our equipment is made to integrate with 15 to 90kg capacity roasters.
