story:
About the Ice Cream Truck of Love

We all like ice cream, so why should those who like a particular flavour miss out on all the fun? The Ice Cream Truck of Love is a non-political, areligious campaign to raise awareness for marriage equality in Australia.

The Senate is currently evaluating its stance on same-sex marriage in Australia, though, we believe this decision belongs with you. Our aim is to send our truck around the country offering ice cream and positive support of marriage equality, all with a simple message: Everyone deserves the opportunity to marry the person they love, no matter the flavour.

What We Plan On Doing

Starting in Sydney, working its way up to Brisbane and then back down the Australian eastern seaboard, the Ice Cream Truck of Love will appear in highly-frequented areas such as city centres, sporting venues and popular landmarks to spread the message to the real people of Australia. In exchange for ice cream, the public can learn how they can become involved in righting the country's stance on same-sex marriage.

How We Plan On Doing It

Through the generous support of financial contribution and pro bono services from our corporate partners, we hope to raise sufficient funds to see the Ice Cream Truck of Love's roadtip realised. Anything above our target will go back into the campaign in order to visit other capital cities and regional centres.

How We'll Use Your Donation

Your kind donation will go directly to funding the Ice Cream Truck of Love and its operation. This will involve leasing and transporting the ice cream truck, hiring of promotional and security staff, insurance, printing of promotional material and accomodation of our Ice Cream Truck of Love team. We appreciate your generosity and in turn will give you our complete commitment to the cause.

Why We're Doing It

We believe it's time this country revisited its outmoded stance on marriage equality. It has nothing to do with religion, nor should be paired with a certain party's political agenda—we just want a basic human right to be offered to everyone.

Please support by contributing to the crowd-funded campaign or by becoming a volunteer. Together we can get the Ice Cream Truck of Love and Australia on the road to marriage equality.
story_txt:
About the Ice Cream Truck of Love
We all like ice cream, so why should those who like a particular flavour miss out on all the fun? The Ice Cream Truck of Love is a non-political, areligious campaign to raise awareness for marriage equality in Australia.
The Senate is currently evaluating its stance on same-sex marriage in Australia, though, we believe this decision belongs with you. Our aim is to send our truck around the country offering ice cream and positive support of marriage equality, all with a simple message: Everyone deserves the opportunity to marry the person they love, no matter the flavour.
What We Plan On Doing
Starting in Sydney, working its way up to Brisbane and then back down the Australian eastern seaboard, the Ice Cream Truck of Love will appear in highly-frequented areas such as city centres, sporting venues and popular landmarks to spread the message to the real people of Australia. In exchange for ice cream, the public can learn how they can become involved in righting the country's stance on same-sex marriage.
How We Plan On Doing It
Through the generous support of financial contribution and pro bono services from our corporate partners, we hope to raise sufficient funds to see the Ice Cream Truck of Love's roadtip realised. Anything above our target will go back into the campaign in order to visit other capital cities and regional centres.
How We'll Use Your Donation
Your kind donation will go directly to funding the Ice Cream Truck of Love and its operation. This will involve leasing and transporting the ice cream truck, hiring of promotional and security staff, insurance, printing of promotional material and accomodation of our Ice Cream Truck of Love team. We appreciate your generosity and in turn will give you our complete commitment to the cause.
Why We're Doing It
We believe it's time this country revisited its outmoded stance on marriage equality. It has nothing to do with religion, nor should be paired with a certain party's political agenda—we just want a basic human right to be offered to everyone.
Please support by contributing to the crowd-funded campaign or by becoming a volunteer. Together we can get the Ice Cream Truck of Love and Australia on the road to marriage equality.

story:
Everyone knows that breakfast is the most important meal of the day, and yet 53% of Americans skip breakfast at least once per week. Existing breakfast options are outdated and unhealthy, so we set out to create a product that makes breakfast quick, energizing and healthy all at the same time. What we created is called Project Breakfast.

There is no reason breakfast has to be full of sugar, dairy and carbs - Project Breakfast is 100% plant based, low in sugar/carbs and high in protein, so you can start your day off right without compromising. It is also keto friendly and 100% vegan!

As for ingredients, we designed the product to provide both energy and sustenance. Each can contains 80mg of caffeine, which is equivalent to about 1 cup of coffee. It also contains 14 grams of protein to keep you fueled through lunch and it has less than 3 grams of sugar and net carbs!

The three flavors we are launching with are

1) Morning Chocolate 

2) Vanilla Chai

3) Green Tea Matcha

Ingredient profile for each flavor can be found below. Thank you for any support and feel free to reach out with any questions you may have about the product!

story:
The SpiceShip is coming, with your help!

 

The SpiceShip is soon to be a destination for small batches of herbs, spices, blends, extracts, and blended oils.  Our shop will feature responsibly sourced products that are kept whole and ground before packaging. Blends will also be available and will be updated frequently.  A variety of extracts will be aged in store and bottled upon request for peak freshness.  

While in the shop take in all of the sights and smells of the various products and their uses.  Books and hot teas are available for the customers while they wait, or if one simply wants to stop by and enjoy the atmosphere.  

 

The Background...

This journey has been about a year in the making.  I've created, thrown out, and re-created a business plan.  I've had success in crafting blends, and total fails as well.  I've vended at networking events and vendor markets.  I've even built a nice little following of customers who are cheering all along the way.  Now it is time to tap into some more funds. 

What Does The SpiceShip Need?

What The SpiceShip needs now is $10k to make sure the first year is a success.  Statistically the first year makes or breaks new businesses.  With ten grand the chance for longevity will be much greater.   Here's a breakdown of how the resources will be utilized:

  • $6k will pay for half a year of rent up front.  This way the profits that are made during these months will be set aside for an emergency fund and a bank for potential replacement costs.
  • $1k is designated for décor and equipment.  
  • $1k  is needed for a year of business insurance and to help with the cost of a business accountant
  • $1k is for stock and packaging supplies.
  • $1k is designated for help with advertising, signage, and media.

The doors to the shop are scheduled to open May 2019!  The excitement is building, and all that's left is the support of a few good people like you.  Check out the reward levels, and pick whichever one moves you!  Any and all contributions are graciously appreciated.

story:
You deserve better meal prep containers. It’s 2019 - plastic won’t cut it.

We had a goal in mind, to create the meal prep container of the future. And we have.

Maintaining a healthy lifestyle is hard enough. You need a container that will do the job and more. So don’t worry, we’ll take care of those pesky downsides containers have for you. 

After the successful launch of Eco Meal Prep™ in 2016, we wanted to continue our mission to raise awareness of plastic toxins in food preparation. 

We're proud to present Australia's first Bento Glass Meal Prep Containers! 

We're in the information era, where not knowing about something’s effects doesn’t mean it won’t harm you. 

So we set out to create a container for modern day needs. A container that’s worthy of 2020 and beyond.

That’s a lot of info right there. Let’s digest it :)

BUILT-TO-LAST

Durable. Durable. Durable. We manufactured Bento Glass to last. 

 High borosilicate glass is a superior type of glass that has a much higher proportion of silicon dioxide in comparison to regular soda lime glass (80% vs. 69%), which makes it significantly less susceptible to damage.

Not to mention; it's FDA-approved!

This was a non-negotiable when creating Bento Glass. 

We want to reduce our impact on the environment, so how counterproductive would it be to create something with only few uses up its sleeve? 

We aimed for long-term benefits. 

IT’S THERMAL SHOCK-RESISTANT

It’s no super-power, but this glass is made to resist extreme temperature changes without flinching.  

Toss it in the microwave, or oven to cook or reheat food. Toss it in your freezer for keeping. Toss it in the dishwasher for cleaning. Toss it anywhere! (not at someone). 

IT’S TOXIN-FREE

Most containers are made from petroleum based plastic which can contain harmful chemicals such as BPA, PVC, and phthalates.

This, unfortunately, means that these toxins have made their way to your food. And even worse: they leach even more when exposed to heat. 

 Fortunately, Bento Glass will have your back, even from the harms you can’t see, smell or taste.

IT’S ODOURLESS

How it should be. 

You’ve probably felt it - a hint of last meals’ dressing in your spaghetti. Suboptimal.

Unlike plastic containers, Bento Glass is resistant to odours and will keep your food fresh until you're ready to eat. 

How do you feel when you open your container and you end up with an unexpected mush of whatever-you-prepared?

Exactly.  

We want you to be able to control your food variety and avoid your flavours from mixing together. 

ALL-THE-WAY-UP DIVIDERS

We wanted to keep food unmixed regardless of how much you toss and turn.

We needed the dividers to do what they are supposed to do: divide. 

To achieve this, we needed our dividers* to go all the way up, keeping food in their designated compartment regardless of what might happen. 

*Only the main (middle) dividers are all-the-way-up.

AND LIDS TO MATCH!

That’s right. We built the BPA-free lid for this purpose with a removable silicone seal. 

This beauty of engineering (for us) works in unison with the dividers, keeping wet foods separated from dry compartments. 

Oh, and did we mention that we made an improvement to the clips? We took our communities suggestions and made removable hinge-locks that are much more durable than our old lids. 

The lids are made of BPA-free polypropylene, and food-grade silicone.

The production of plastic has increased twenty-fold since 1964 and is expected to double in the next 20 years. 

“But I recycle!” - you might think. 

Unfortunately, only 5% of plastics are recycled effectively, while 40% end up in a landfill or in fragile ecosystems such as the world’s oceans.*

Plastic waste comes not only from packaging or plastic bags. There’s no use for plastic food containers once they are damaged. 

And what's even worse? The rise of pre-cooked single use meals in throw-away plastic containers...

We need something better.

 Bento Glass containers are first off: reusable.

For those of you not familiar with meal prepping, these containers tackle single-use head first. So there’s a win. 

Second, Bento Glass is more durable than regular glass and can be recycled efficiently. That’s another, greater win in our book!

*https://www.theguardian.com/business/2016/jan/1...

Not all meals are made equal. 

That’s why Bento Glass Meal Prep Containers come in two super convenient variations! 

1. The Bento Glass Snack Prep Container - for the conscious snacker.  

 Two’s the magic number - where variety meets practicality. 

It’s not lunchtime, yet. But you just remembered that you brought with you those two delicious food combo’s that will ease your hunger, give that boost of energy, and boom! You’re ready to go!

Perfect to fit your snacks and low-calorie or ketogenic meals!

 -

 2. The Bento Glass Meal Prep Container - for heavy duty meal preppers

 You’ve meal prepped and ready to tackle the week ahead, and want to keep the flavours intact and separate, as they should. 

We’ve got you covered. 

Three means we have a party!

Ideal for high-calorie meals and portion control. This bad boy will help you keep track of your goals and eat what you planned for, no more, no less.  

Most glass containers are often over/undersized - designed for storing leftover food in the fridge. 

We took Bento Glass one step further by prioritizing your meal prep needs. 

This means not too big, not too small. Just the right size for your meals and easy transport to your work or your gym.

Here’s how they measure:      

So you can pick & chose and find what works for you.

Note: all measurements are for a single container

- 

 

 NOTE: We've projected delivery for November at the latest to give us enough time for production and quality assurance! In the best case scenario, we'll have your orders delivered by the end of September provided we don't have any delays.

If you'd like to write about us, download the press kit here. Don't hesitate to reach out to admin@ecomealprep.com if you have any questions.

 Why Indiegogo?

We’re a small but passionate team at Eco Meal Prep™ and we want to make a difference. We truly believe Australia needs these containers. Only 5% of plastics are recycled effectively, while a disturbing 40% end up in landfill. 

Buying and throwing away precooked single-use meals in plastic containers may be convenient, but this quick fix is not sustainable for our health nor the environment. 

To put it simply, we lack the immediate funds to manufacture these containers at the highest quality, which is why we’ve turned to our amazing community. 

For full transparency, the funding of this campaign will allow us to manufacture the Bento Glass Meal Prep Containers at the highest quality and have everyone's orders shipped in a timely manner. 

It will also cover the costs of bringing this campaign to life such as acquiring prototypes, graphic design, photography, videography, content creation, marketing, Indiegogo fees and so much more!

We’ve given our absolute best to bring this campaign to life and we're forever grateful for your support!

story:
Seasoning Stix are solid "sticks" of seasonings, spices and herbs, which are inserted into meat, fish and poultry prior to cooking to season from the inside out.

At approximately 110F food science takes over.  Water is driven out, Seasoning Stixs begin to liquify and the meat absorbs the seasonings like a sponge.

It's the first major change in seasonings in 1,000 years.  

So unique it's already been award three U.S. Patents.

 

*** SPECIAL FOR INDIEGOGO NEWSLETTER SUBSCRIBERS ***

At the $75 Level Receive all FIVE Blends SUPERSIZED INCLUDING the New Blend - APPLEWOOD BOURBON

*ALL Supersized to over 100 STIXS* 

 

Traditionally, there are two popular methods for seasoning meats - applying seasonings to the outside prior cooking and marinading, but neither method is perfect.  Actually, neither works very well at all.

Seasoning Problem One: 

  • Applying seasonings to the outside does not season the inside and it can burn during cooking.  This can create bad tastes.
  • Seasoning on the outside falls off, burns and does not penetrate.  

Seasoning Problem Two:

  • Marinates are messy, time consuming and don't really work. 
  • Food scientists call it the Myth of Marinade.  Truth is marinades barely penetrate meat.  
  • Commercial marinates are really unhealthy and full of high fructose corn syrup, sodium and chemicals.   Yuck!

 

Seasoning Stixs season meat, fish and poultry from the inside out helping you create delicious dishes for yourself, friends and family.

The fact is that meat fibers are mainly water and all that water is simply in the way.  Until some of that water is displaced, nothing is going to season meat properly.  

Seasoning Stixs are solid seasonings and spices, which are inserted into meat prior to cooking.  

At approximately 110F the sticks begin to liquify allowing the meat fibers to absorb all the seasoning goodness as the water is displaced, effectively seasoning and marinading from the inside out.

Making delicious meat, fish and poultry with Seasoning Stixs is really simple:

  • Select you favorite Seasoning Stix blend
  • Insert Stixs into you favorite meat, fish or poultry.  The seasonings travel into the meat up to several inches, so only few Stixs are need for small cuts: insert more for large cuts or for even more flavor.
  • Cook, Grill, Barbecue, Roast as normal
  • Enjoy your delicious meal Seasoned From the Inside Out

 Our Kickstarter backers will receive all four of our initial blends:

  • Classic Garlic made with Organic California Garlic from the garlic capital of the world, Gilroy, California.
  • Backyard Barbecue made with honey, brown sugar and classic BBQ seasonings and spices.
  • Herb de Provence, the classic French culinary seasoning.
  • Thai Satay, an ambitious blend to help you cook with Thai flavors, but in an entirely new way.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Patents in the culinary world are very rare.  Such intellectual property protection takes a considerable time and expense to obtain, but fortunately it is something our team has already completed - A significant achievement. 

We currently hold three patents on Seasoning Stixs.  These are issued patents; not patents pending, which is super exciting for our growing company.

  • Seasoning Stick and Method and apparatus for Preparing Foods - A solid seasoning product in the form of a stick, rod, thread, band, bead, pellet or ribbon from 20 mils to 250 mils thick and having a geometry as a shaped mass that enables the product to be inserted into or mixed with food comprising meat, poultry, rice, grains or other particulate foods prior to heating to prepare the food.
  • Seasoning Device and Method for Preparing Foods - Invention relates to a seasoning device or product, and more particularly to a method for preparing and seasoning foods, especially meats and poultry.  

This will ensure our efforts and your backer money will be  used to produce a product and to help grow a company that will have a secure future.  

We also believe these patents will be attractive to established seasoning and spice companies that have seen little product innovation in decades. 

 

The word to describe our planned timeframe for delivery of Indiegogo Perks is:

FAST!

Here's why we are able to plan such a quick shipment of your Seasoning Stixs.  

Here is what we have done so far:

  • DONE - Two Years of Planning and Research
  • DONE - R&D
  • DONE - Manufacturing Process Selection 
  • DONE - Manufacturing Trials
  • DONE - Raw Materials Sourcing
  • DONE - Manufacturing Equipment Purchased

This means that once our Indiegogo campaign closes we will IMMEDIATELY be going into production to produce your Seasoning Stix.  

No messing about for us.  Perks Expected in Time for Summer Barbecues with Friends and Family.  We are not messing around!  We are a highly qualified team.

We know that Indiegogo supporters want timely delivery of backer perks and we are very excited to be in a position to meet our promised timeframe for delivery.  

WE ARE READY TO GO!

Here it is in Katherine's own words:

 

How does food taste when Seasoning Stixs are used?  A Great Question

The simple answer is that when Seasoning Stixs are used to season meat, fish or poultry from the inside out the flavors are more pronounced and intense.

Simply delicious, in our opinion. Here's the summary of our first set of blind taste tests.

 

We have diverse set of perks for our backers.  We thank you for all levels of support.  Worldwide shipping included for all perk levels.

*** SPECIAL FOR INDIEGOGO NEWSLETTER SUBSCRIBERS ***

At the $75 Level Receive all FIVE Blends SUPERSIZED INCLUDING the New Blend - APPLEWOOD BOURBON

*ALL Supersized to over 100 STIXS* 

We have packed the $75 pledge level with even more enhancements, including our new Applewood Bourbon Blend, which was selected as the favorite among our supports in a vote.  The $75 pledge level now includes:

  • 2.5X MORE SEASONING STIXS FOR EACH BLEND - That's over 100 Stixs of each of the four blends
  • SUPERSIZED Applewood Bourbon Blend to over 100 Stixs
  • Gift packaged
  • E-Cookbook by our Chef with Seasoning Stixs Grilling, BBQ and other meal preparation ideas
  • Shipping included ANYWHERE in the world (all levels get free shipping)

 

 

Seasoning Stixs are being brought to the market by an experienced team of professionals in various disciplines.   Here's the team:

Katherine Zuniga - Katherine is the leader of Seasoning Stixs.

Nevin Jenkins - Our Inventor.  Nevin has invented and manufactured products that have produced billion of dollars in sales.

Richard Butler - Valued team member.

Elliott "Trent" Thompson - Video crew and part time hand model.

Shan Sabellano - Our social media master.

Marko Sipka - Graphic Artist for the project. Marko lives in Serbia.

Kalab Lin - Video production supervisor.

Gene Aversa - Our video editor.

Charlyn Kwiatkowski - Our video and audio location specialist.

The E Group - We are excited to have worked with the E Group Design, which provided the GIFs and artwork for sections of the campaign. 

Online Press Kit - The electronic press kit can be viewed at: Seasoning Stixs Press Kit.

 

 

 

 By: Edward Frascino and licensed from The New Yorker and the Cartoon Bank.

Food scientists call it the Myth of Marinade.  Truth is marinades barely penetrate meat.  
Commercial marinates are really unhealthy and full of high fructose corn syrup, sodium and chemicals.   Yuck!
Marinades are messy, time consuming and many are filled with unhealthy ingredients like high fructose corn syrup and preservatives. Seasoning Stixs season meat, fish and poultry from the inside out helping you create delicious dishes for yourself, friends and family.The fact is that meat fibers are mainly water and all that water is simply in the way.  Until some of that water is displaced, nothing is going to season meat properly.  Seasoning Stixs are solid seasonings and spices, which are inserted into meat prior to cooking.  At approximately 110F the sticks begin to liquify allowing the meat fibers to absorb all the seasoning goodness as the water is displaced, effectively seasoning and marinading from the inside out.Making delicious meat, fish and poultry with Seasoning Stixs is really simple:
Select you favorite Seasoning Stix blend
Insert Stixs into you favorite meat, fish or poultry.  The seasonings travel into the meat up to several inches, so only few Stixs are need for small cuts: insert more for large cuts or for even more flavor.
Cook, Grill, Barbecue, Roast as normal
Enjoy your delicious meal Seasoned From the Inside Out
Using Seasoning Stixs is really easy - 1) Select a Blend, 2) Insert a few Stixs, 3) Cook as Normal, 4) Enjoy Seasoning From the Inside Out. Our Kickstarter backers will receive all four of our initial blends:
Classic Garlic made with Organic California Garlic from the garlic capital of the world, Gilroy, California.
Backyard Barbecue made with honey, brown sugar and classic BBQ seasonings and spices.
Herb de Provence, the classic French culinary seasoning.
Thai Satay, an ambitious blend to help you cook with Thai flavors, but in an entirely new way.
 Classic Garlic will likely be our most popular blend. It is certainly the staff's favorite. Made with Organic California Garlic and a blend of organic seasonings, herb and spices. Wonderful in steaks and chicken. A unique blend enabling you to season with classic BBQ sauce flavors from the inside out. An updated version of the classic French blend for Herb de Provence. Marinades from the inside out with classic French flavors. Enhanced with a dash of organic white turmeric. Peanut butter inside a Stix? YES! - A bold blend with powdered peanut butter and classic Thai flavors that helps you season from the inside out.  Patents in the culinary world are very rare.  Such intellectual property protection takes a considerable time and expense to obtain, but fortunately it is something our team has already completed - A significant achievement. We currently hold three patents on Seasoning Stixs.  These are issued patents; not patents pending, which is super exciting for our growing company.
Seasoning Stick and Method and apparatus for Preparing Foods - A solid seasoning product in the form of a stick, rod, thread, band, bead, pellet or ribbon from 20 mils to 250 mils thick and having a geometry as a shaped mass that enables the product to be inserted into or mixed with food comprising meat, poultry, rice, grains or other particulate foods prior to heating to prepare the food.
Seasoning Device and Method for Preparing Foods - Invention relates to a seasoning device or product, and more particularly to a method for preparing and seasoning foods, especially meats and poultry.  
This will ensure our efforts and your backer money will be  used to produce a product and to help grow a company that will have a secure future.  We also believe these patents will be attractive to established seasoning and spice companies that have seen little product innovation in decades. 
 Not One, Not Two, But Three U.S. Patents Have Been issued for Seasoning Stix
 The word to describe our planned timeframe for delivery of Indiegogo Perks is:FAST!Here's why we are able to plan such a quick shipment of your Seasoning Stixs.  Here is what we have done so far:
DONE - Two Years of Planning and Research
DONE - R&D
DONE - Manufacturing Process Selection 
DONE - Manufacturing Trials
DONE - Raw Materials Sourcing
DONE - Manufacturing Equipment Purchased
This means that once our Indiegogo campaign closes we will IMMEDIATELY be going into production to produce your Seasoning Stix.  No messing about for us.  Perks Expected in Time for Summer Barbecues with Friends and Family.  We are not messing around!  We are a highly qualified team.We know that Indiegogo supporters want timely delivery of backer perks and we are very excited to be in a position to meet our promised timeframe for delivery.  WE ARE READY TO GO!Here it is in Katherine's own words:
 Play

 
Replay with sound


 
Play withsound



00:00


00:00
 
 
 




 
 
 
 

 

 How does food taste when Seasoning Stixs are used?  A Great QuestionThe simple answer is that when Seasoning Stixs are used to season meat, fish or poultry from the inside out the flavors are more pronounced and intense.Simply delicious, in our opinion. Here's the summary of our first set of blind taste tests. We have diverse set of perks for our backers.  We thank you for all levels of support.  Worldwide shipping included for all perk levels.*** SPECIAL FOR INDIEGOGO NEWSLETTER SUBSCRIBERS ***At the $75 Level Receive all FIVE Blends SUPERSIZED INCLUDING the New Blend - APPLEWOOD BOURBON*ALL Supersized to over 100 STIXS* We have packed the $75 pledge level with even more enhancements, including our new Applewood Bourbon Blend, which was selected as the favorite among our supports in a vote.  The $75 pledge level now includes:
2.5X MORE SEASONING STIXS FOR EACH BLEND - That's over 100 Stixs of each of the four blends
SUPERSIZED Applewood Bourbon Blend to over 100 Stixs
Gift packaged
E-Cookbook by our Chef with Seasoning Stixs Grilling, BBQ and other meal preparation ideas
Shipping included ANYWHERE in the world (all levels get free shipping)
With more than two years invested in this project we are ready to begin manufacturing. R&D, test runs, prototyping, blend development and even the purchase of the production equipment have all been completed.  The Seasoning Stixs Kickstarter TeamSeasoning Stixs are being brought to the market by an experienced team of professionals in various disciplines.   Here's the team:Katherine Zuniga - Katherine is the leader of Seasoning Stixs.Nevin Jenkins - Our Inventor.  Nevin has invented and manufactured products that have produced billion of dollars in sales.Richard Butler - Valued team member.Elliott "Trent" Thompson - Video crew and part time hand model.Shan Sabellano - Our social media master.Marko Sipka - Graphic Artist for the project. Marko lives in Serbia.Kalab Lin - Video production supervisor.Gene Aversa - Our video editor.Charlyn Kwiatkowski - Our video and audio location specialist.The E Group - We are excited to have worked with the E Group Design, which provided the GIFs and artwork for sections of the campaign. Online Press Kit - The electronic press kit can be viewed at: Seasoning Stixs Press Kit.
Get Your Project Funded Today! 
Get Cash Back on the Projects You Love!
   By: Edward Frascino and licensed from The New Yorker and the Cartoon Bank.

story:
Our Story

In 2010, our founder Steffen Johnson, joined the United States Army and shipped from his hometown of Rehoboth, MA to Fort Riley, Kansas. In 2012 Steffen was deployed from Fort Riley, Kansas to serve on an overseas tour in Afghanistan. While pulling guard and having a conversation with one of his buddies, he was asked “what do you want to do after the Army?”. Steffen’s response to this question is what sparked the dream of opening a community-based brewery back in his hometown. Shortly after Steffen’s return he began discussing his dream of going professional with his high school buddy Dan DiRienzo.

 

Over the following years, Steffen and Dan began to brew and develop recipes while continuing to pursue the dream of one day going commercial with their passion project. After years of searching for the perfect place to call Anawan Brewing Company home, they finally found a place. All the way back in 2012 when Steffen said he wanted “to open a brewery” he had his hometown of Rehoboth, MA in mind as to where he wanted to open. With your help we can bring our dream of over 8 years to fruition in the beautiful, historic town of Rehoboth, MA!

 

Award Winning Beer

Over the several years that Steffen and Dan have been brewing together they have received multiple medals, awards, and recognition for their quality handcrafted beers. With over 75+ unique beer recipes there is bound to be a beer that everyone can enjoy. ABC is committed to their motto of being “Independent, Handcrafted, and Local”.

 

From Homebrewing to Commercial

While homebrewing out of our garage has been fun, we are unable to get the beer out to the public. This second, and final campaign will allow us to gather the funds allowing us to open a 1600 square foot brewery and taproom in Rehoboth, MA. We believe through the help of supporters like you we will be able to put Rehoboth on the map as a craft beer destination for years to come.

 

Community-Based Brewery

The Rehoboth taproom will not only be a place for customers to enjoy beer on-site or to go, but it will be an asset to the town as well. From the beginning of our dream we always stood by the saying of having what we call a “community-based brewery’. To us a community-based brewery is one that will support local business and organizations all through the love of craft beer. We are dedicated to having a positive impact on the community and staying true to our motto of being “Independent, Handcrafted and Local”.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Opening Rehoboth’s first brewery and taproom has proven to be no small task, but with your help we can finally make our dreams a reality! Our $17,500+ goal is what we'll need to finish interior construction on our taproom and purchase brewing equipment so we can offer the highest quality beer possible this Fall/Winter 2020. 

We greatly appreciate your contributions and will be offering a bunch of great rewards as token of our appreciation. The perks we will be offering are as follows:

- Pint Glasses
- ABC/"Keever" Artwork & Sticker Pack
- T-Shirts
- Sweatshirts
- Merch bundles
- Barn Raisers Club Membership
- Mug Club Membership
- "Golden Growler" Club Membership
- Brew and Name a Beer Party
- Ultimate Founders Party Bundle

Your Impact

The past 8 years have all been leading up to this moment. We have tirelessly searched and finally have a place that we believe will be perfect for the brewery and taproom of our dreams. Your contribution to our project represents a unique opportunity to be a part of something special and extremely impactful.

We want to thank you all for checking our campaign out. If you can't contribute, please consider sharing this with your friends, or family to help us spread the word!

We can never thank you all enough for the never-ending support, and we are working tirelessly to get this place built to serve some amazing beer as soon as possible! Please don't hesitate to contact us with any questions you may have.

Cheers, 

Anawan Brewing Company

story:
Short Summary

Mama Donna's Bakery and Honey & Rose Bakery are launching a joint venture as two independent bakeries located in West Chester, PA. Mama Donna’s Bakery creates exceptional breakfast pastries and baked goods for luxury apartment complexes, hotels, and restaurants. Honey & Rose Bakery creates extraordinary custom cakes, cupcakes, and homemade granola for local retail as well as wholesale markets. Together, we intend to reintroduce consumers to small-batch, locally sourced, high quality, all natural and sustainable ingredient products - farm to oven, oven to fork. 

  • Non-GMO flours
  • Organic, cage-free eggs
  • Non-GMO butters and creams
  • Raw sugars and honey
  • Natural flavors and colors
  • No preservatives

To accomplish this goal, we are targeting the luxury markets, as these are the clients that are best positioned to appreciate the quality,sustainability, and skills that we can offer. 

These markets allow us to use the professional skills developed in our previous careers and become not just vendors, but true client partners who work hard to help our clients enhance their luxury brands.

As an example, Mama Donna's Bakery currently partners with a 275-unit luxury apartment complex for the 55+ demographic. As the exclusive provider of their daily continental breakfast, we work with the property manager and staff to ensure all products are tailored to meet the residents' needs at a level of quality that enhances the luxury brand.

As we continue to scale up and establish our brand within these markets, we can expand our impact on the local economies by hiring staff and sourcing local ingredients. 

What We Need

Our most immediate and very pressing need is to move into a space that serves as a production space for our products, with enough room to include a tasting/demo room for clients. We have located a suitable space; however, with our current lease at the Artisan Exchange expiring at the end of January, we have to be prepared to move very quickly.

Immediate Needs - 10 Day Flash Funding:

  • $3,500 for first/last month's rent + security deposit
  • $1,200 for licensing and inspections
  • $2,500 for insurance
  • $8,000 for equipment (larger oven, plumbing, electric)
  • $800 for professional movers

This flash funding will move us out of our current space and into the new space as quickly as possible without having to interrupt production.

Once settled, we can begin to address longer-term goals for a more extensive build-out that will support our expansion.

What You Get

Check out our perks! Cookies, handmade bagels, breakfast treats, and even a cake decorating demo are just some of the great Thank You gifts we can offer in return for your donation. The first 10 funders will find some extra special goodies in their shipment.

The Impact

Mama Donna's and Honey & Rose bakeries both began operations about three years ago as part of a local community kitchen called the Artisan Exchange. The Exchange serves as a small business incubator for food producers where entrepreneurs can have access to fully licensed commercial kitchen space to test, refine, and sell their products. For two start-up bakeries, it's been an invaluable resource, but we are both quickly outgrowing the space and need to make the jump to reach a wider base of customers. We are ready to fly!

We need your help to make this happen! Given the limitations we face by working out of a community kitchen, we are not able to raise all of the necessary capital to make the leap to the next level. We have a small window for making the transition from the community kitchen space and into our own space where we can be fully prepared for future growth. 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge right now is timing. In a perfect world, we will be able to transition smoothly out of the leased spaces we currently occupy and into our own space without needing to interrupt production or deliveries to our customers. This is why this campaign must be done now...with money in hand, we can lock in the new location and begin the work of making our move. The good news is that the space we identified needs a minimal amount of work to be functional. 

In the meantime, we're preparing Plans B, C, and D....just in case!

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate and respect that not everyone can donate! You are still a loved and welcome member of our community and campaign! 

- Social media is a key factor in building a successful business and best of all, it's free! Share our story and campaign on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, or any other social media platform you choose. Let the word out and help people find us!

- If you're in our area (Chester County, PA), visit Honey & Rose Bakery at one of the farmers' markets where her products are currently sold. Buy yourself a treat! Take a selfie with us! Tell your family and friends about your awesome discovery!

- Send us a review. Have you tried any of our delicious items? If you loved it, let us know! We will post your testimonial to our website and social media pages. Let your voice be heard!

- Refer us to your favorite coffeeshop, hotel, restaurant...let them know that premier baked goods are only a phone call away!

story:
Short Summary

Brandy was brutally murdered for absolutely no reason, and I am here to help her family and friends, including myself, be able to sleep at night by highlighting the good that Brandy carried throughout life.
With any money raised, we will start a scholarship fund in Brandy's name for high school students interested in persuing a degree in fine or performing arts.
I established a memorial account at Huntington Bank to assist me in this fund raising. It is called the Brandy Rosine Memorial Fund,
acct: 01780228415.
 
Please see this article for details on the crime: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/07/27/brandy-stevens-rosine-case-love-triangle_n_1711393.html
 
The following is the eulogy I gave at her funeral:
 
"Ladies and gentlemen, family and friends, I would like to thank you for coming today. My name is Krysti. My family lived behind Brandy from the time she was in sixth grade through the time she moved in with her grandparents in highschool.

When I met Brandy, she possessed a teenage angst the size of a football stadium. And I loved that about her. Brandy never settled for anything less than she wanted. Brandy loved deeply and entirely. She was passionate, and had the ability to express her passion through words and actions. She once wrote, “We humans live for compassion. It is written in Darwin. In every known clinical research done, humans strive for that one hug from their mother or that one comforting word from a friend.”

Brandy shared that when she was a toddler, she would get time-outs for yelling at her mother from the backseat of the car to drive faster. This may have led to her receiving a go-kart as a child. She loved going to her cousins to go four-wheeling. ”I learned that it’s fun to ride in the rain,” she said, “That donuts aren’t good for the yard, and thorns are hard to remove. Not from my skin, but from my helmet.” She just wanted to go fast.

Her friends remember taking adventures with her. Diet Mountain Dew, Diet Vault, like Brandy needed energy drinks. They remember lying on the pavement staring at the stars with her. Holding her hand, taking walks, going to concerts. She fell in love with music, as she was a poet as well. She proudly claimed herself an orch-dork in highschool.  Brandy would play Mario Kart and DJ Hero all day if she could.  Brandy was as clever as a fox, and perhaps the most witty person I’ve known. She said once, “If it wasn’t for having to see other people naked, I’d live in a nudest colony.”

I was recently asked what Brandy does for a living. Well… Brandy is a comedian. She’ll pick you up with words. She’s a librarian, an encyclopedia of knowledge. Brandy is a therapist, a shoulder for all of her friends. She lived for helping others, for making other people feel comfortable, for love. Brandy is a musician. She is a spectrum of colors, a renaissance woman, if you will.

All Brandy wanted was to be herself in a world without prejudice, and I believe Brandy achieved that goal. Brandy was an inspiration to others to not fear who you are, but to embrace yourself.

And nothing of this has changed. Brandy is still all of these things. She’s just counting on us to activate our memories and keep her alive.  She shared 20 years with us, and now it is time to cherish those years.

Thank each and every one of you for coming today. Brandy would poop her pants to see the amount of support and love that keeps pouring her direction. Thank you."

Brandy's obituary:

 

CANFIELD - Friends may call Saturday afternoon from 1 to 3:45 p.m., followed by a memorial service held at 4 p.m. at the Higgins-Reardon Funeral Home, Boardman-Canfield Chapel for Brandy M. Stevens-Rosine, 20, who died May 17, in Pennsylvania.

Brandy was born in Youngstown on Nov. 30, 1991.

She was a 2010 graduate of Boardman High School, she then enrolled in Youngstown State University to study sociology. While a student at Boardman, Brandy was a member of the orchestra, served on the staff of the “Bugle,” the high school paper and was a member of the Italian and Key clubs. Brandy loved music, writing and enjoyed reading. She regularly attended literary meetings at the Boardman Library.

She will always be remembered as a kind hearted, easy going person with many friends.

She is survived by her mother, Carrie Rosine and her companion, Kevin Gold of Hubbard; grandparents, Richard and Kathy Stevens of Poland and Cindee and Jerry Rosine of Boardman; a sister, Stephanie Rosine; three stepsisters, Lexi, Haley and Kylie Gold; an aunt, Brenda (AJ) Barrett; and nephews, Ethen and Dylan.

She was preceded in death by her father, Michael Rosine and great-grandmothers, Joann Chirns and Ada Harris.

The family has requested that material tributes take the form of donations to a memorial fund in her memory at Huntington Bank.

Professional arrangements are by the Higgins-Reardon Funeral Home, Boardman-Canfield Chapel."

http://www.vindy.com/news/tributes/2012/may/25/...

What We Need & What You Get

Brandy's mother has set a goal of 1,500 dollars for the scholarship.

For anyone who donates, I will mail them a Brandy Rosine wristband! (Or more, depending on what you donate and what you'd like!)

The Impact

The impact of this project is immeasurable, as what it means will mostly be expressed by emotion. I personally look forward to the look on Brandy's grandmother's face when she sees something for her granddaughter finally solid and stable again for the first time since May 17th, 2012.

If there ever was a cause to support, I'd say it's this one. And I wish I could personally hug every single person who has helped me recently. I couldn't thank everyone enough!

Other Ways You Can Help

Keep the word alive is really all I ask. When this goes to trial, keep an eye on it. Send a letter to the judge, magistrate Michael Rossi of Crawford County Pennsylvania.

Not from my skin, but from my helmet.” She just wanted to go fast.
Her friends remember taking adventures with her. Diet Mountain Dew, Diet Vault, like Brandy needed energy drinks. They remember lying on the pavement staring at the stars with her. Holding her hand, taking walks, going to concerts. She fell in love with music, as she was a poet as well. She proudly claimed herself an orch-dork in highschool.  Brandy would play Mario Kart and DJ Hero all day if she could.  Brandy was as clever as a fox, and perhaps the most witty person I’ve known. She said once, “If it wasn’t for having to see other people naked, I’d live in a nudest colony.”
I was recently asked what Brandy does for a living. Well… Brandy is a comedian. She’ll pick you up with words. She’s a librarian, an encyclopedia of knowledge. Brandy is a therapist, a shoulder for all of her friends. She lived for helping others, for making other people feel comfortable, for love. Brandy is a musician. She is a spectrum of colors, a renaissance woman, if you will.
All Brandy wanted was to be herself in a world without prejudice, and I believe Brandy achieved that goal. Brandy was an inspiration to others to not fear who you are, but to embrace yourself.
And nothing of this has changed. Brandy is still all of these things. She’s just counting on us to activate our memories and keep her alive.  She shared 20 years with us, and now it is time to cherish those years.
Thank each and every one of you for coming today. Brandy would poop her pants to see the amount of support and love that keeps pouring her direction. Thank you."
Brandy's obituary:
 
CANFIELD - Friends may call Saturday afternoon from 1 to 3:45 p.m., followed by a memorial service held at 4 p.m. at the Higgins-Reardon Funeral Home, Boardman-Canfield Chapel for Brandy M. Stevens-Rosine, 20, who died May 17, in Pennsylvania.
Brandy was born in Youngstown on Nov. 30, 1991.
She was a 2010 graduate of Boardman High School, she then enrolled in Youngstown State University to study sociology. While a student at Boardman, Brandy was a member of the orchestra, served on the staff of the “Bugle,” the high school paper and was a member of the Italian and Key clubs. Brandy loved music, writing and enjoyed reading. She regularly attended literary meetings at the Boardman Library.
She will always be remembered as a kind hearted, easy going person with many friends.
She is survived by her mother, Carrie Rosine and her companion, Kevin Gold of Hubbard; grandparents, Richard and Kathy Stevens of Poland and Cindee and Jerry Rosine of Boardman; a sister, Stephanie Rosine; three stepsisters, Lexi, Haley and Kylie Gold; an aunt, Brenda (AJ) Barrett; and nephews, Ethen and Dylan.
She was preceded in death by her father, Michael Rosine and great-grandmothers, Joann Chirns and Ada Harris.
The family has requested that material tributes take the form of donations to a memorial fund in her memory at Huntington Bank.
Professional arrangements are by the Higgins-Reardon Funeral Home, Boardman-Canfield Chapel."
http://www.vindy.com/news/tributes/2012/may/25/...


What We Need & What You Get
Brandy's mother has set a goal of 1,500 dollars for the scholarship.
For anyone who donates, I will mail them a Brandy Rosine wristband! (Or more, depending on what you donate and what you'd like!)


The Impact
The impact of this project is immeasurable, as what it means will mostly be expressed by emotion. I personally look forward to the look on Brandy's grandmother's face when she sees something for her granddaughter finally solid and stable again for the first time since May 17th, 2012.
If there ever was a cause to support, I'd say it's this one. And I wish I could personally hug every single person who has helped me recently. I couldn't thank everyone enough!


Other Ways You Can Help
Keep the word alive is really all I ask. When this goes to trial, keep an eye on it. Send a letter to the judge, magistrate Michael Rossi of Crawford County Pennsylvania.

story:
El Cook

I was born and raised in Los Angeles and have always been passionate about cooking food. Mexican food in particular has influenced me, from spicy to sweet dishes - it continues to inspire me to create and expand my knowledge in this beautiful cuisine. Living in Finland for the past 9 years, I began to miss the food I loved and with limited ingredients here, I had to start from scratch to create the dishes I was longing for. Now I have an extensive menu that takes me back to my hometown! This is what I want to deliver to my new home, Helsinki.

Mexican food has been getting more and more popular since I moved here in 2009. This has inspired me to gain experience in a professional kitchen, research and establish my own business starting with a small taco stand - exactly the way Mexicans did it when they migrated North & started a food revotution that is now known all over the world. 

For many years I've wanted to open my own business to share my passion and love for food with as many people as possible. My hope is that one day, this will be a place for friends and families to meet & enjoy good food and drinks. 

 

La Tricycle

The goal for this crowd fundraiser is to help me get the equipment I need to get started. Also, to help spread the word and gain some momentum in my early days. Donations will be greatly appreciated and I plan to give back to my backers by providing a snack, meal or even cater an event. 

This will be a one man operation and I will be selling my food via an eco-friendly mobile food stand - a Tricyle :) While this method has its challenges, it gives me the freedom and flexibility to be able to start and potentially grow this business as fast as I can. 

Los Backers

All contributions help, including helping me spread the word to get this out to as many people as possible. I appreciate any help you can send my way!

story:
When we take a common ingredient, and mix it into peanut butter, the allergy causing protein is neutralized and the peanut butter becomes allergy free!

Dr. Travis Honeycutt has identified and isolated the protein in peanut butter that causes the dangerous peanut allergy. That protein can be rendered harmless by mixing into peanut butter an ingredient that changes the allergy protein molecule.

If every peanut butter manufacturer added just a trace amount of this ingredient to their final product, then all peanut butter would be allergy free.

This Project will fund the final testing and FDA approval so that an allergy free peanut butter will become available at your local grocery.

We Need $70,000

If we can get this solution through the last hurdles of testing, then we can bring this product to market and eliminate the fear that schools and hospitals have when serving peanut butter.

The Impact

2% of the population is allergic to peanut butter. Hospital emergency rooms deal with this allergy more than any other allergy in our country. This simple solution will reverse that reality.  

Risks & Challenges

Travis Honeycutt will bring this solution to market by licensing peanut butter manufacturers to use his patented process. The hurdle is to get this solution out of testing and then to convince one of the prominent American manufacturers to run a test market sample using their own allergy free brand.

If this doesn't happen in a timely manner, then we will license a family run manufacturer to bring allergy free peanut butter into market. We believe that will motivate the larger manufacturers to consider the same solution to keep their products competitive.

We believe that within 5 years every product with peanut butter as an ingredient will be using allergy free peanut butter.

Facebook
